likedText:
This hotel is a real gem, I loved the art deco design and music from that era playing it was like stepping back in time!

Staff also very friendly and helpful with ideas for trips and restaurants etc. 

There is a water machine providing hot and cold water along with tea/coffee which is a nice addition, and breakfast choices were varied.
reviewTitle: A wonderful experience of days gone by!
propertyResponse:
Dear Jennifer,
Thank you so much for your kind and thoughtful review!
We’re thrilled to hear that you had such a wonderful experience at Ceria Hotel. It’s especially rewarding to know that you appreciated our art deco design and nostalgic atmosphere. We love creating that “step back in time” feeling for our guests. We're also glad that our team could assist you with recommendations and that you enjoyed the amenities like the water station and our varied breakfast options.
Your kind words mean a lot to us, and we hope to welcome you back again for another memorable stay.
Warm regards,
Ceria Hotel

likedText:
- All staff are very friendly and keen to help
- Our room (Junior Suite) is spacious with high ceiling 
- Complimentary Wi-Fi is fast and stable
- Air-conditioner works pretty well
- Both natural light and in-room lighting are great and sufficient
- Quiet inside the hotel (an important thing for a good night sleep)
- Free bicycles for hotel guest to use
- We like the food (breakfast) at the hotel cafe (best french fries we had in Yogyakarta)
- Money exchange service partner came to the hotel to serve with good exchange rate
- The retro decor is lovely
- Location is in walking distance to JL Malioboro
dislikedText: - The hotel lobby opens to a busy street with little room for taxi/vehicle parking
propertyResponse:
Dear Mrs. Yung Lin,

Thank you so much for your detailed and thoughtful review! We are truly delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay in our Junior Suite and appreciated the spacious layout, lighting, and retro decor. It’s also wonderful to know that our team’s friendliness, Wi-Fi connection, breakfast, and free bicycle service made a positive impact on your experience.

We do acknowledge your feedback regarding the lobby entrance being on a busy street, and we truly appreciate your understanding. Your insights help us continuously improve our service and guest experience.

We hope to welcome you back to Yogyakarta again soon!

Warm regards,
Ceria Hotel Management

likedText: Had a wonderful stay in Yogyakarta! The room was super comfortable and I really loved the overall vibes, especially the charming vintage decor. Breakfast was good and very filling — a great start to the day. I also appreciate that the place has its own cafe. I tried the V60 brew and the cassava cheese cake — both were lovely! Would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a cozy and stylish stay in Jogja.

likedText:
Superb. One of the most enjoyable stays we've had in our travels.
The buildings, decor and furnishings are all in the art deco style even down to the 1940's music that plays in the background creating a wonderful atmosphere. Surrounding each of the buildings is a beautifully maintained garden with many specimen plants.
Great location, close to many of the tourist sites.
Our room was clean, well maintained with a comfortable bed. The water purifier, cooler/heater outside the room was a very nice touch meaning ice cold water or hot coffee/tea was there whenever we wanted it.
The staff at the hotel were some of the friendliest and most helpful we've come across.
A good breakfast is served as well as meals available throughout the day, all of good quality.
We thoroughly enjoyed our four night stay and would happily return and recommend the Ceria Hotel to others.
dislikedText: Nothing

Thank you so much for your wonderful review!
We are truly delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciated the Art Deco atmosphere, the gardens, and the little touches like the water purifier and coffee/tea station. likedText:
I like everything about the hotel. It is really beautiful, clean and comfortable. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. We had welcome drinks and a piece of bread pudding when we checked in . The breakfast served was delicious and the portion was big. There's umbrellas that we can borrow since it's rainy season. The water pressure was great , there's hot water for shower. Distance from hotel to Jalan Malioboro was quite close. Probably 10 mins walk. Nearby a street selling gudeg! There's a mini market right opposite the hotel . The room was very comfortable . But there were quite some mosquitoes but it's ok, we killed them all upon stepping in! XD 
Love everything ! You won't be disappointed at all!

likedText: Muy buena atención y ubicación
dislikedText: La habitación tenía un solo toma corriente (enchufe) en un lugar que dificulta enormemente la conexión de dispositivos electrónicos

Posto pessimo, pulizia terribile. Nel bagno non c'era il lavandino C'è n'era uno sul ballatoio sempre in condizioni di sporcizia estrema. Non accettano la carta di credito a differenza di quanto scritto su booking e, non avendo abbastanza contanti con me, ho dovuto discutere mezz'ora con il ragazzo alla reception (che non parlava inglese ma usava il traduttore) perché non voleva darmi la camera anche se era mezzanotte ed ero sola con mio figlio che non stava più in piedi dal sonno. Ho anche proposto di pagare almeno la prima notte ma non voleva saperne. Alla fine alzando la voce mi ha lasciato la camera che ho puntualmente saldato la mattina dopo prelevando quello che serviva.

El hotel era barato y quizas por eso no se puede pedir más. 
El baño me pareció lo peor, no tenía lavabo ni había papel higiénico, tampoco agua caliente.
El personal no me pareció bien. Llegamos temprano y nos dijeron que no tenían habitación disponible, después nos dijeron que sí pero que había que pagar..Nos dieron un importe y cuando fuimos a pagarlo, lo subieron, trataron de explicar  que era porque no se podía pagar con tarjeta... pagamos lo que pidieron porque yo me encontraba mal pero no me pareció correcto.

dislikedText: No habia nadie en recepción y no nos cogían el teléfono. 1h esperando que tuvimos que reservar otro hotel porque nos vimos en la calle. La habitación no estaba limpia y tenia telarañas, les pedi que me limpiaran la habitación un poco mejor y para mi sorpresa pasaron una fregona por el suelo y la ducha y limpiaron una de las telarañas que les enseñé para hacer el amago. Lamentable. Supuestamente teníamos desayuno el cual no vimos. La entrada era compartida con algo que parecía una tienda y no hablan apenas inglés. No volvería

dislikedText: Kamer liet te wensen over. Wasbak viel bijna van de muur, bedden waren niet heel comfortabel. Zou hier niet nog eens boeken.

likedText:
The best hostel I’ve ever stayed at – and I’ve stayed at many!

I’ve traveled a lot in my life – through Latin America, Europe, and Asia, often on long-term trips. I’ve seen countless hostels along the way, but Nooze Hostel has been by far the best I’ve ever stayed in – for several reasons.

First of all, the building itself is simply beautiful: welcoming, cozy, and exceptionally well-designed, with so many thoughtful little details. What I especially loved is the natural sunlight that fills the space – it creates such a warm and calming atmosphere. And despite being in the heart of Yogyakarta, it’s wonderfully quiet, tucked away in a small side street with no traffic noise at all.

The location is perfect: just a short walk to the city’s main attractions – the Palace, the Water Castle, and the most famous museums. Even the lively Malioboro Street is only a few minutes away, but you’re not right in the middle of the hustle.

But what truly sets Nooze apart is the team. It was hands down the most attentive, friendly, and helpful staff I’ve ever experienced in a hostel. They took the time to help me with personalized recommendations – not just generic tips, but advice based on what I was actually interested in. They also supported me with booking transport and anything else I needed for my journey. On top of that, they were always up for a warm chat – always smiling.

I really hope the owner knows what a strong team she/he has. And even though I didn’t meet her/him personally, it’s obvious that someone put a lot of heart and care into creating a truly exceptional experience. The level of detail is just incredible.

I’ll definitely be coming back – and I can recommend Nooze Hostel from the bottom of my heart.
reviewTitle: The best hostel I’ve ever stayed at – and I’ve stayed at many!

likedText: Really nice hostel, lovely staff and good breakfast!
dislikedText: Nothing

Hi, Robert!
How are you doing? Hope you have a great day ✨

Thank you so much for taking the time to leave such a lovely and thoughtful review. We're so happy to hear that you had a great experience during your stay with us. It truly means a lot to our entire team to know that you found the hostel well arranged, clean, and welcoming.

We’re especially glad that you enjoyed our breakfast and laundry service, and that you found some good spots to relax and chill around the property. Also, thank you for the kind words about our staff, it’s always our pleasure to help with recommendations and tips to make your Yogyakarta adventure even more special.

As for the room temperature, thank you for understanding. While the room you booked doesn’t include air conditioning, we do have several other room types available that are equipped with AC for extra comfort, so if you decide to stay with us again (and we really hope you do!), we’d be happy to help you choose one that suits your preferences best.

We also appreciate your note about the bathroom sink. We know that sharing facilities can get a little busy at peak times, and we're currently looking at ways to improve the space and flow in our shared areas. Your feedback is super helpful and helps us grow!

Thanks again for staying with us and for spreading such good vibes. Wishing you all the best on your travels, and we hope to welcome you back soon for another warm and memorable stay!

Warmest regards,
Dida and Snooze Team

likedText:
Snooze is a home stay hostel. And that is how it felt, like coming come. When we arrived the amazing girls greeted us with so much enthusiasm and love. We got some coffee and a hostel tour. During the tour someone else brought our heavy backpacks to our rooms. 

Inside the hostel they have amazing breakfast with fresh fruit, which is being made for you by their chef. They also make their own ice cubes so no worries about that while ordering an ice coffee. Everything is so clean; the rooms, toilet, shower (which is cold but we loved it after a hot day), kitchen and living room. They even have an amazing jungle garden. 

All the girls are so personal and love to make a chit chat with you. After a day in Yogyakarta coming back in the hostel feels like coming home again. “How was your day, did you enjoyed it, what did you do? Do you want some coffee?” Loved that! 

Besides this we got to travel with the hostel driver: Imam. He drove us to Borobudur and Prambanan. It was an amazing day, Imam is amazing. We learned and laughed a lot with him. After the day he felt like a good friend. Would recommend everyone to drive with Imam for the day. Ask the reception if he is available and you will have a lovely day.
propertyResponse:
Hello again Maaike!
It's nice to e-meet you here.
How are you? Hope everything is perfectly fine.

Thank you so much for this absolutely beautiful and thoughtful review!

Reading your kind words truly made our entire team's day! It means the world to us that you felt like our home was a home away from home, because that’s exactly the feeling we hope to create for every guest who walks through our doors. From the moment you arrived, we could tell it was going to be a special connection, and hearing how warmly you remember the welcome, the coffee, and even the tour gives us the biggest smiles.

We’re so happy you noticed and appreciated the little touches, like the fresh fruit breakfasts prepared with love by our kitchen team, the handmade ice cubes (yes, we’re a bit proud of that 😄), and of course, the cleanliness of all the spaces. Our team works hard behind the scenes to keep everything fresh and cozy, and it’s so rewarding to hear it made a difference in your stay.

Our little jungle garden is a favorite spot of ours too, perfect for a peaceful coffee or just relaxing after a day of adventures. And we absolutely love hearing that you enjoyed the casual chats and warm check-ins from our team at the front desk. We're genuinely enjoy connecting with our guests, and we’re glad it made you feel cared for and at home. 

And of course… Imam! What can we say? He’s truly one of a kind and he's the favourite among us too. It makes us so happy to know your trip to Borobudur and Prambanan with him was not only smooth and fun, but meaningful too. He really does have a way of making people feel at ease, sharing stories, and turning a day trip into a special memory. We'll make sure he reads your sweet words, he'll be so touched!

Thank you again for taking the time to share your experience in such detail, it’s guests like you that make what we do so rewarding. We already miss you around here, and we hope one day you’ll come back and stay with us again. There will always be a warm welcome (and coffee!) waiting for you.

Warm Regards,
Dida and Snooze Team

likedText:
Helpfull & very friendly host. They even prepared a booklet with all usefull information about city’s atractions.

Area is clean and quiet (for us is no problem with calling for a prayer), but super close to the center, museums, shops and restaurants - so You can enjoy the city by 5-10min walk. Yogya has nice artistic vibe and everywhere grows green plants.
Breakfast is included - You can appreciate the art during the eating :) Room is comfortable and very clean, with WIFI.
It’s easy to get there by cheap train or take a Grab Taxi from the AirPort. Highly recommeted!
reviewTitle: Helpfull & very friendly host + near to the city’s atractions by walk

likedText: Well located within the city, just a bit hidden - follow the signs:) super clean, comfy room, hot shower, very helpful and friendly owners

Amazing position to reach everything, located in the middle of a dedalus of little streets downtown which gave it a very local atmosphere. Liked the style of the room, bed was comfortable.

Maybe better offer and recommendation of tours would also be helpful, even if the host was a very wonderful person who helped us a lot.

likedText: The room is very simple and clean. The owners are lovely people, very welcoming and friendly. The breakfast was good and they also packed us lunch for the train ride to Probolinggo
dislikedText: You can ear a bit the mosques around but with earplugs (provided by them) I didn’t have any trouble sleeping.

likedText:
Everything was perfect from the easy check in to the delicious breakfast. It was super clean and also very comfortable in a cozy local neighbourhood and on top of it, wow what a host!

If I ever come back, this place is a must for me
dislikedText: That I only stayed for three nights…
reviewTitle: Definitely the place to be while in Jogja 🎉

likedText: Such amazing hosts that prepared delicious breakfast for us each morning!

Excellent location for nearby sights and food markets. Hosts were amazing with a great breakfast and advice on things to see and do. Great communication from start to finish and staying here feels like you're part of a really friendly community. Consideration has been given to items in rooms, for example ear plugs and mosquito repellent, which was really helpful while out and about!
reviewTitle: Exceptional property in the heart of Yogykarta

likedText: Owners are very friendly, and it is located in a good area. Breakfast was also delicious, and I was able to sleep in the room with two fans just fine.
dislikedText: Only downside is the loud mosque prayer calls, but they provide ear plugs to help

likedText: The room was clean and everything was well provided. Towels and toiletries were prepared for guest which is much appreciated.
dislikedText: Nothing not to like at all.
reviewTitle: Mas Rolly and wife were good hosts and my stay was pleasant. Appreciated that Mas Rolly also shared places to visit and

likedText:
Lala and Rolly are wonderful hosts! They’re so friendly and helpful - we had a lovely time staying in their guesthouse. 

They have had a hot shower system installed recently which is really good! 

All of the breakfasts they offer are so delicious - we will truly miss the egg sandwiches and Indonesian rice and noodles they made for us! Breakfasts always included fruit, cold water and coffee too. In the mini kitchen, you can boil water at any time and there’s a free water refill too.

The guesthouse is very convenient for local sites and is in a quiet (if you’re a light sleeper, the hosts provide ear plugs too) and peaceful location. We thought the room was very cute and well decorated. 

Highly recommend for a stay in Yogyakarta!

Very artistically decorated guesthouse. 
- great location in yogya close to landmarks.
- water refill available onsite in communal kitchen.
- amazingly tasty and filling breakfast!!
- very kind and welcoming hosts.
The room was lovely, and good value for money. The host was so kind and made us takeaway sandwiches when we missed breakfast! Great homestay in Yogyakarta
Good value for the price. Great breakfast. Make sure if you’re arriving at night that you have good instructions on how to get there as the laneway is not accessible by car.
dislikedText: Cold shower and bed on the floor

likedText: Super friendly stay with great hosts. The room was perfect and breakfast as well! 😁
We had a wonderful stay at Nomore. The room is lovely, location central, staff is very friendly and helpful and the breakfast tasty :)
Great hosts, lovely place and scrumptious breakfast!

Very clean and homey at a good price! Lala and Rolly were very nice and accommodating to our needs, they even packed us breakfast on days we had early tours/ flights and gave us some bread in the afternoon when we missed breakfast for the day.  ❤️
reviewTitle: Really enjoyed our stay here! Perfect for budget travelers ❤️

likedText:
This hostel is a little gem in Yogyakarta. It has a very nice lounge/reading area and the whole eco concept is shown on all areas of the hostel. I really liked the architectual style and fit out, which made me feel very rested and comfortable while staying there in March 2025. 

A big plus is the free online guide to Yogyakarta they put together with all necessary tips, place to go and eat, etc to make sure you get the best out of your stay.

They also have a large kitchen and dining area downstairs and free water refill.

likedText: The hotel is very well located and overall very pleasant. Room 505 was clean, the hot water worked without any issues, and the air conditioning functioned perfectly — which is especially important in this region. Breakfast was very good, mostly catering to Asian tastes, which is understandable. The coffee was excellent! The staff deserve special mention: friendly, helpful, and truly a 10/10.
dislikedText: Cleaning seemed a bit superficial — corners, edges, and the tops of wardrobes didn’t appear to be thoroughly cleaned. Maybe I’m a bit picky, but I believe many European guests notice these details. There was no separate hand soap, just a wall-mounted dispenser in the shower, which felt inconvenient. The shower itself could use renovation: the water pressure was weak, the shower head kept moving, and the curtain was too short and should be replaced. The windows weren’t sealed properly and should be improved.

roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

likedText: The hosts are really friendly and attentive. Nice, quiet location and walking distance to the train station and Malioboro.
dislikedText: The shared bathroom and fridge could really do with a deep clean, but considering the price of this place I think you have to expect to get what you pay for. I'd still recommend it if you're not fussy.

likedText: Hospitality and attention are priceless. Simple but cozy facilities. Everything is clean and orderly. Yos, the owner, is extremely helpful and an exceptional human being. Helped arrange a cheap motorbike rental and was always helpful to welcome me.
dislikedText: Everything good.
roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

likedText: Friendly host. Quiet location in a side street. The host can give you lots of information about the area. The spacious beds in the room.
dislikedText: Shower cabin flooded the toilet as well. A lot of hair was on the floor. A window right above the bed lets in a lot of light. Recommend to put a curtain there.

likedText: The husband and wife who own this hostel have helped me a lot since the first day I arrived. We often chatted about the places I should see in the city and they gave me good recommendations. Owner Yos helped me a lot to rent a motorbike and even took me to places that provide motorbike rental services with his own motorbike. Yos is a very good man. The hostel was very clean, you can use the kitchen, the internet is good and there are many places to eat locally and markets in the area. There is also a seating area in the garden and beautiful fish you can watch :)
roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

likedText: We enjoyed being in an area with the locals and not surrounded by the tourists. The couple who own the property were very helpful. Excellent recommendations for local food to try! We were grateful for the Gudeg recommendation! Very welcoming and friendly. Great vale for money.
dislikedText:
There were a few questions about the local sites that they couldn’t answer which I was surprised about. I passed on all the information I found out though so that should be solved now. 
Expect family home clean not hotel clean. We didn’t mind at all but just an fyi.

likedText: What an amazing bunch of people. Nice and homey and totally worth the money!! Cute little front garden. Top stay and they were amazing people😁
dislikedText: N/A

likedText: The owners were lovely, they helped with everything.
dislikedText: The bathroom was very rustic, the room’s window didn’t have glass and the bed had no sheets only one small blanket.
propertyResponse: Thank you for the review you provided. Regarding special windows in standard and family rooms, they do not use glass but wooden windows in accordance with our hostel concept. For beds in all rooms, each uses bed sheets and blankets as well as towels, but specifically for standard rooms, there are 2 blankets and 2 towels, and for family rooms, 4 blankets and 4 towels.

likedText: Friendly host, clean and comfortable hostel that is located right in the middle of the artistic city. A good place for those who like to visit ArtJog and explore the neighborhood of the Ngampilan.
beautiful garden where you can sit and relax. clean facilities with everything you need.
dislikedText: the area is a bit quite. you have to walk a bit or take the scooter to the center.
reviewTitle: Beautiful hostel with very friendly and welcoming owners. Clean facilities with everything you need. Absolutely enjoyed
roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

dislikedText: The hostel is not in the center as they say and I did not feel like it's a backpacker hostel at all. When I came there there were only two local families with small children and no other travellers. I switched hostels after 1 day.
propertyResponse: Hi Adriana, Thanks for your review. When you stay, you are with other foreign guests and two domestic family guests in another room. We apologize if at that time there were no other foreign guests, but before and after your arrival, many foreign guests came..🙏
roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

likedText: location
dislikedText: 2 bed room not using Air Conditioner, too hot in the evening

likedText:
The villa is in a fantastic location.  We walked everywhere.  
The villa owner was lovely.
We only used the 2 air conditioned rooms. They were clean, neat and comfortable.
reviewTitle: A wonderful place to stay in a fantastic location

likedText: The place is close to everything, it is very quiet. You can walk to malioboro street or north alunalun. There is also a bakpia factory down the street.
dislikedText: There are four rooms. Two of them do not have AC, but they are open to outside air, so mosquitos get in the room.

likedText: Newly built villa that has a bali vibes, Located in the center of jogja (in a very quiet neighborhood), the 2 bedrooms with ac were comfy (the other 2 without ac were kinda hot but well it was summer), swimming pool was clean, fully functioning kitchen, and friendly neighbors.
dislikedText: Outdoor floor that are leading to the bathroom were slippery(need some scrubbing maybe?), checking in process was a bit complicated, and the parking fee was 50k/car/night even though the description on Booking.com says its around 10k, the staff didn't even respond to me when i asked them about it. Ended up spending 300k/3 nights for 2 cars.
propertyResponse:
Hi Angie, I’m glad you chose to stay with Bukit Vista. Thank you for writing this review, it means a lot for us. 

I’m sorry to hear that you are unhappy with some of our services during your stay. We have checked the floor as you mentioned, and we agreed that it needs deep cleaning like we did from time to time. The parking fee is out of our control since it’s a public parking, but we think this is important to have accurate  information for guests. 

I do understand that people have different levels of expectations, but to give guests unpleasant experience is unacceptable and we are committed to fix this issue. 

We’ve done property-wide deep cleaning to ensure best experience for our future guests. And we have a dedicated person that will be standing by waiting for guest check in, even in the middle of the night. We are now offering to cover the parking fee for 1 car for our guest and updated the information.

As our commitment, we are giving you a refund of Rp 300,000,- to cover the parking fee that you paid. 

We are happy to host you and hoping you would stay with us again in the future. 
- Bukit Vista Joglo Kawung

地理位置很好，日惹皇宫、博物馆都是步行距离（能满足游客了解当地文化，对于看惯了各地大皇宫的人，不有点soso）。距离日惹火车站1.5km，可以步行。游泳池很受家人喜欢，连着3天都在池子里玩水了。宗教氛围很浓，很多宗教活动。推荐一日游，浮屠和普兰让我觉得不虚此行。

likedText:
Die Lage ist sehr gut. Mitten in einem kleinen sehr ruhigen Viertel und doch fußläufig zum Trubel der Marliboro, zum Fort und zum Kraton.
Die beiden hinteren Zimmer sind hubsch und haben eine Klimaanlage.
dislikedText:
Die beiden vorderen Zimmer sind nicht benutzbar.  Die Wände gehen nicht bis zur Decke. Man schläft quasi im Freien. Nachts kommen viele Mücken. Moskito-Verdampfer und Mückenspirale haben nicht geholfen.  Unsere Sohne waren total zerstochen. Das ist auch eine Gesundheitsgefahr. 
Man könnte die Zimmer problemlos abdichten und eine Klimaanlage einbauen. 
Fur Menschen,  die nur zwei Zimmer nutzen, ist das Haus toll.  Die beiden vorderen Zimmer kann man nicht bewohnen.
reviewTitle: Vorsicht - zwei der vier  Zimmer sind nicht nutzbar

likedText: location is ok. it is really clean and well maintained. owner is friendly. good value for money. booked 4 nights here!

Staffs are friendly and helpful. Location is good. Pretty quiet. 
Some sofas / places to sit and eat are available in the common area. 
Good wifi connection (inside and outside).
Bath towels, soap, toothbrush & mini paste and water bottles are provided. Airco and warm water are working. Big beds with comfortable matresses, some tables available in the room.
dislikedText:
Bathroom is old and haven't been renewed for a long time; a lot of spots on the toilet and door, walls have mold, doorknob is loose.
There are spots seen on the sheets.
Ants in the room.
There is a rubbish bin outside the room (ok, good), but it would be handy to have one in the room too.
reviewTitle: Well located and friendly staff, but need to be cleaner and have bathroom renewed.

Man läuft ca 10 min in das Zentrum - Malioboro sowie Bahnhof; die Betten sind in Ordnung und es ist eine Klimaanlage sowie Badewanne, Toilette sowie Waschbecken vorhanden. Das Wasser läuft ebenfalls, größtenteils auch warm.
Wir konnten außerdem zuvor einchecken, was uns gut gelegen kam, da wir von einer 35h Reise ankamen.

Der Ablauf des Waschbeckens ist kaputt. Das Zimmer wurde frisch sauber gemacht, jedoch noch dreckig von von vielen Vorgängern. In der Luft lag eine dauerhafte Feuchtigkeit (Schimmel?) und die Abflüsse stinken. 
Das angegebene Frühstück war eine kleine Lunchbox ohne Getränke. Wir hatten danach noch Hunger.

likedText: Great hotel in the heart of Yogyakarta. Amazing room, great shower, amazing big bed. Location is great. The breakfast options are very good.
dislikedText: Don’t have a free drinking water to refill the bottle. This would be very nice for saving the Planet.
propertyResponse:
Dear Andreja,

Thank you for sharing your amazing experience at Novotel Suites Yogyakarta Malioboro. We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, especially the central location, spacious room with a big bed, refreshing shower, and diverse breakfast options.

Regarding your feedback on free drinking water refills, we truly appreciate your thoughtful suggestion for supporting sustainability. Our glass bottles are currently not designed for refills due to hygienic considerations. However, we offer additional drinking water for only IDR 5,000 per bottle if needed. Additionally, during breakfast at Food Exchange, you’re welcome to use the water dispenser to refill your own tumbler. Your suggestion has been noted and will be considered as we strive to improve our services.

We hope to welcome you back soon for another memorable stay.

Warm regards,
Fitria A.
Front Office Manager

likedText: the location is closed to malioboro street
dislikedText: “Suites”, but no stove in the mini-kitchen
propertyResponse:
Dear Condro,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We’re delighted to hear that you appreciated our convenient location near jalan Malioboro.

Regarding your comment about the absence of a stove in the kitchenette, we understand your concern. For safety reasons and in accordance with the brand standards, we are only able to provide a microwave as a replacement for a stove. We take pride in being the only Novotel brand to feature a kitchenette in our rooms to assist with our guests’ needs.

However, I regret that this limitation impacted your satisfaction with our facilities and the perceived value of your stay. Your input is invaluable, and we truly appreciate your perspective as it helps us improve our services.

We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and provide you with an even more enjoyable experience.

Warm regards,
Fitria A.
Front Office Manager

likedText:
The location is superb. Close to becak and andong. The breakfast is delicious.
The swimming pool area is nice. Also the staffs are smiley and helpful. They can recommend tourists must go sites. Thank you Pak Sigit.
dislikedText:
The room is smelly (cigarette  smell is so pungent). Sometimes we can smell sewer water too. 
The soundproof is not enough. We can hear other room's bell clearly.
propertyResponse:
Dear Tinneke,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We’re delighted to hear that you enjoyed our superb location, delicious breakfast, and the relaxing atmosphere of our swimming pool area. Your kind words about our smiley and helpful team, especially Pak Sigit, mean a lot to us. It’s wonderful to know that our team could assist with recommendations for must-visit tourist sites.

However, we regret that your experience with the room did not meet your expectations. We are truly sorry to hear about the cigarette smell, occasional sewer odor, and insufficient soundproofing. These are not the standards we strive for, and we will address these concerns with our team immediately to ensure improvements are made.

We also noticed that you rated us lower in terms of value for money and comfort. We would appreciate it if you could provide us with more details about your expectations and how we can enhance our service and facilities to serve you better.

Thank you for bringing these matters to our attention, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for a more enjoyable stay in the future.

Warm regards,
Fitria A.
Front Office Manager

likedText: The breakfast is great! It has a wide selection of items.
dislikedText: There is an ongoing renovation work and it started at 6 am. Unbelievable
propertyResponse:
Dear David,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast offerings and the wide selection of items we provide. It’s wonderful to know that this contributed positively to your stay.

We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused by the construction noise during your visit. The renovation work you experienced was actually from the mall side, and unfortunately, we were not informed that they would continue their work so early in the morning. We immediately addressed the issue by postponing their work to minimize any disturbance to our guests. We deeply appreciate your patience and understanding.

Regarding the Fitness Center, we are truly sorry that it did not meet your expectations. Your feedback is invaluable, and we will be reviewing this area to ensure that we provide the best possible value for our guests.

Thank you once again for your insights. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back and providing a more seamless experience.

Warm regards,
Fitria A.
Front Office Manager

likedText: Location is great, right in the middle of Malioboro. Room is clean, staff were so friendly and helpful.
propertyResponse:
Dear Raisa Adrian,

Thank you for your kind feedback! We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our prime location in the heart of Malioboro, and that you found your room clean and our staff friendly and helpful. It’s always wonderful to know that our guests have a pleasant experience with us.

We truly appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts. We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to Yogyakarta.

Warm regards,  
Fitria A.  
Front Office Manager

dislikedText: - The stay was expensive by any standards, especially for Indonesian standards. But if you are a Western tourist on a short trip to Jogja, it is probably one of the best alternatives, along with Meliã.
propertyResponse:
Dear Luís Filipe,

Thank you for your thoughtful review and valuable feedback! We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our diverse breakfast, rooftop bar, swimming pool, and the comfort of the bed and pillows. It’s great to know you found our room spacious and elegant, and that the shower pressure met your expectations. We’re also glad you appreciated our central location on Malioboro area, making it easy to explore one of Jogja's main tourism attraction.

We understand your concern regarding the cost, and we truly appreciate your perspective. Your feedback is important, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Warm regards,
Fitria A.
Front Office Manager

likedText: The location is very good at the heart of Malioboro. Near to the malls and street vendors.
dislikedText: The hotel lobby is trash. Very difficult to park your car and it is only 1 way

propertyResponse:

Thank you for sharing your feedback and rating us 8.0! We’re happy to hear that you enjoyed our prime location in the heart of Malioboro, with easy access to malls and street vendors.

We sincerely apologize for the challenges you faced with the hotel lobby and parking due to the layout of our building. We understand how this may have caused inconvenience, and we truly appreciate your understanding. Your feedback is invaluable, and we are improving to look into ways to enhance the overall parking experience for our guests.

We hope to welcome you back soon and provide an even better experience.

Warm regards,

likedText: Everything was great, breakfast was amazing
dislikedText: Pool hours close at 19:00, pool glass disturb the view, pool is closed if raining.

Thank you so much for your kind feedback! We’re delighted to hear that you had a great stay and enjoyed our breakfast. We always strive to offer a variety of delicious options to start the day right, and it’s wonderful to know it met your expectations.

Regarding the pool, we close it during rain for safety and security reasons, as it’s located on the rooftop. We also appreciate your comments about the glass and will consider ways to enhance the view. We hope to welcome you back soon for another memorable stay!

Fitria A.  
Front Office Manager

likedText: very comfortable bed. interesting location
dislikedText: the only thing I think International travelers should understand is that this hotel doesn't have the ability to process credit card from outside Indonesia which creates a huge hassle when checking in and out.
reviewTitle: Nice hotel but pay in cash if you don't have Indonesian credit cards.
propertyResponse:
Dear Marc,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We are glad to hear that you found the bed comfortable and appreciated our location. We also value your constructive comments regarding the payment process.

Regarding the issue with credit card payments, we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused. This was due to a temporary issue with our local bank, but we are pleased to inform you that it has been resolved and settled accordingly within less than a week. We have also sent an email to update you on the matter and confirm that everything has been cleared.

Your feedback is invaluable, and we are committed to improving the guest experience. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future.

likedText: Very central location and all a Novotel should be
dislikedText: Breakfast could have had more vegetarian options.

We also appreciate your suggestion regarding more vegetarian options at breakfast. We'll definitely look into expanding our choices to cater to all dietary preferences. Your comments are important in helping us improve.

We hope to welcome you back again soon!

likedText: We traveled all over Java and needed a room for one night in Jogja before catching a flight to Bali. We chose a perfect hotel! The location of this property is an absolute value: right in the middle of the city and only steps away from one of the main attractions, Malioboro Street. Staff were friendly and efficient; They allowed us to check in early as we got to Jogja way before check-in time. We love the hotel's rooftop: we had brunch while we waited for our room and an evening drink later at sunset. The food at the rooftop bar was delicious, and the view was pretty amazing. The staff at the rooftop bar was friendly and attentive, always ensuring we had all we needed. The room was clean and functional. The view of the city from our room was nice. As somebody who grew up in Jogja, I felt a lovely nostalgia to see a familiar view from the room. The following day, it was an easy walk too to get to the train station and catch our airport train to YIA.
reviewTitle: Short but lovely stay in the middle of Jogja
propertyResponse:
Dear Miko,

Thank you for your fantastic review! We’re thrilled to hear that you chose our hotel for your stay in Jogja and that it met your expectations. Our central location, just steps from Malioboro Street, truly offers great convenience for our guests.

We’re glad our staff could accommodate your early check-in and that you enjoyed brunch and evening drinks on our rooftop. It’s wonderful to know you found the food delicious and appreciated the stunning views.

We’re also pleased that you felt a sense of nostalgia from your room and enjoyed the clean and functional accommodations. Being so close to the train station makes travel easy, and we’re happy you found it convenient for your journey to YIA.

We truly appreciate your feedback on the cleanliness and comfort of your room. We strive for a perfect 10/10, and your kind words motivate us to continue improving our services.

Thank you once again for sharing your experience. We hope to welcome you back for another lovely stay in the future!

Warm regards,
Fitria A.
Front Office Manager

likedText: Breakfast was good and hotel staffs very helpful and approachable
dislikedText: To have access to youtube or netflix
propertyResponse:
Dear Noordin Osman,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us! We’re glad to hear that you enjoyed the breakfast and found our staff helpful and approachable. Your comments about accessing YouTube and Netflix are greatly appreciated, and we will certainly look into improving this aspect for our guests.

We value your input and hope to welcome you back soon for an even better experience!

Warm regards,
Fitria A.
Front Office Manager

likedText:
Hotel is situated along the vibrant Malioboro Street, next to two shopping malls and a night market, and within walking distance from the train station (taking train from the airport is much more convenient and faster than taking car), yet far enough from the street and railway noise. Royal palace and water castle are 5-10 minutes away by Andong (horse carriage) or Becak (motorised rickshaw).

Staff are friendly and helpful, but I guess it applies to the locals. People are always smiling and courteous. 

Big comfortable room.

Nice rooftop swimming pool.

Free parking at the basement.
dislikedText:
Buffet breakfast has the quantity but quality can be improved.

Traffic around the train station and Malioboro Street can be heavy and messy during the day, and Malioboro is closed to motorised vehicles from 6-9pm everyday (not a good thing if you are returning by car although there is still a way to drive to the hotel).
propertyResponse:
Dear Soo Kee,
Warmest greeting from Novotel Suites Yogyakarta Malioboro.

Thank you for staying for four nights with us and taking your precious time to tell us about your stay experience. Your complete and detail feedback surely will help other readers who want to stay with at Novotel Suites Yogyakarta Malioboro.
We notice your concern on our breakfast quality during your stay, it is valuable source of learning for us. Related department will be notified regarding this issue. It is important to us hearing from you and we thanks for your attention.

We hope we could serve and welcome you better on your next visit to Yogyakarta. Once again thank you and appreciate for your warm feedback. Novotel Suites Yogyakarta Malioboro will always be your "far away" home every time you travel to Yogyakarta.

Kind Regards,
Windhu Kurnia (Duty Manager)

likedText: The rooms were modern, well appointed, quiet, and clean. The beds were comfortable. Close to main tourist sites. Not so resort-like, but still unfussy and cosy. I was able to walk with my luggage to the train station in 12 minutes, which beat the traffic by 40 minutes. Note, I requested a room without a view to get some sleep (can't hear prayer call) - which was fine if all the room is used for is sleeping. Great stay!
reviewTitle: Cozy, modern, unfussy - close to attractions and train station - quiet rooms available
propertyResponse:
Dear Damian,

Thank you for your wonderful review. We’re delighted to know that you found our rooms modern, clean, and comfortable. It’s great to know that our location near Malioboro street and the train station was convenient for you.

We’re pleased that the quiet room suited your needs and contributed to a restful stay. Your feedback on the balance between a cozy atmosphere and convenience is much appreciated.

Thank you again for choosing to stay with us. We look forward to welcoming you back for another great stay in the future!

Best regards,
Fitria A.
Front Office Manager

likedText: Good location, nice staff and facilities
dislikedText: The room was small for 4 members of the family. There was no lock to the bathroom door which was surprising.
propertyResponse:
Dear Mr. Pankaj Khobragade,

Thank you for sharing your valuable feedback. We’re glad to hear that you found our location, staff, and facilities to your liking.

I apologize for the inconvenience you experienced with the room size and the bathroom door lock. Our standard room is designed to accommodate 2 adults and 2 children under 12 years old with existing bedding, which might sometimes feel a bit snug for a family of four. We understand that this can affect your comfort and regret that it fell short of your expectations.

To enhance your experience on future stays, we offer larger room options for an additional charge. Our Deluxe Room, which is 34 sqm, or the Executive Room at 40 sqm, could provide the extra space and comfort that might be more suitable for your family. If you decide to visit us again, please let us know if you would like to explore these upgrade options.

We truly appreciate your feedback as it helps us improve our services. Thank you once again for choosing our hotel. We look forward to the opportunity to welcome you and your family back and to provide a more comfortable stay.

Best regards,
Fitria A.
Front Office Manager

likedText: Nice looking room with enough space for an extra bed. Lots of choice at the breakfast buffet. Nice rooftop area with swimming pool, bar and gym.
dislikedText:
We thought the location at Malioboro street would be convenient but it turned out to be a constant traffic jam resulting in long waiting times for a Grab or GoJek to get anywhere.

The bathroom had a sliding door with rails only at the top, not at the bottom, so it was very noisy to get into / out of the bathroom when roommates were sleeping.

We had noisy neighbors with kids literally tearing the place down. Banging at the walls, screaming in the room and hallway, slamming the door, and it felt like the walls were made of cardboard. Not soundproof whatsoever!
propertyResponse:
Dear Jochen,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We're pleased to hear that you enjoyed the spacious room, the variety at our breakfast buffet, and the amenities in our rooftop area, including the swimming pool, bar, and gym.

We apologize for the inconvenience you experienced with the location. Traffic congestion around Malioboro Street can sometimes be challenging, and we regret that it impacted your experience. 

Regarding the bathroom door and noise issues, we appreciate your comments and will look into improving the soundproofing and door design to enhance guest comfort. We’re also sorry to hear about the disturbance from other guests. Ensuring a quiet and restful environment is important to us, and we will address this with our team to better manage noise levels.

Thank you once again for your valuable feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to provide a better experience on your next visit.

Best regards,
Fitria A.
Front Office Manager

likedText: The 101 Style Malioboro boasts a central location, just a few minutes' walk from the lively Malioboro Street - ideal for shopping and street food. The hotel offers a modern design with clean, well-equipped rooms, albeit somewhat compact. The staff are friendly and helpful, check-in went smoothly.
dislikedText: The breakfast is plentiful, but the quality still has potential. There are small compromises in the brightness of the rooms.
reviewTitle: Stylish city hotel in a very good location
roomInfo: Deluxe Double or Twin Room with City View

likedText: Staff is excellent. Accommodated requests for laundry or minor leak repair quickly and efficiently. Elevators are fast.  Beds are comfortable! (Though the bathrobes must be for 45kg Asian women. Not 95 kg Americans!) View of mountain nice but too foggy the 3 days we were there.
dislikedText: Became a bit bored with breakfast. Coffee needs to be improved. Tried espresso, Americano, brewed, latte. None were good in my opinion (maybe sugar or milk would have covered it up; but I don’t use those.) more fresh fruit would be nice too.
reviewTitle: Great location for my first trip to Yogyakarta.
roomInfo: Deluxe Double or Twin Room with Mountain View

dislikedText:
untuk sekelas reddorz ini uda cukup baik, mskp tdk ada layanan room service, minimal bed sheets diganti setelah pergantian tamu, kamar yang saya tempati, bed sheets nya bau.

likedText: La ubicación
dislikedText:
En los tres días que estuvimos no limpiaron la habitación ni cambiaron las toallas. 
E lo va Walter va se va salía, así que me siempre había agua en el no suelo.

likedText:
Location wise it is very good. Not too far from the mad crowd of Malioboro, yet it is very quiet and relaxing. Surrounded by so many food restaurants. Walking distance to Alun-Alun Kidul where it is a fun piazza with many angkringan. 
The home itself, was very well taken care. Every room (5 rooms!) has its own bathroom. 
Drinking water, tea, coffee, sugar, available in the kitchen.
dislikedText: No hot water

likedText: We loved the location. The house itself has 5 rooms, each with their own bathroom. There's a kitchen at the back. The neighborhood is noisy (it's the city) but the rooms at the rear of the house are quiet enough, so that was very nice. The owners set us up with a super nice driver to took us to see the temples. The house is about 10 minutes away from the Kraton, 20 minutes away from the Fort and 30 minutes away from the train station.
dislikedText: The house was not extremely dirty but it wasn't clean either (the kitchen sink, the floor and especially the bedsheets).
reviewTitle: Comfy little house 10 minutes away from the Kraton.

likedText: The host was great.
dislikedText: The kitchen could have been a bit cleaner.
reviewTitle: Great place for a family or group , great location.

likedText: The location was great for us. The host helped us for making tour arrangements and showing us good places to eat. Any problems were quickly sorted out by the host. Important stuff was all OK, hot water is good, easy to make drink, get water and so on. Great beds! Our host was easy to contact by phone at any time and communicates quickly and very well.
dislikedText: The bathrooms need a little maintenance. The outdoor area and kitchen needs a very good clean and take out the old stuff and clean up the garden. It could use some information in English for the foreign tourist with no Bahasa Indonesia?
reviewTitle: Easy property for a family or group travelling together.

likedText: La localisation était idéale, proche des attractions et commerces. Il y avait aussi un grand nombre de chambres avec leurs salles de bain privatives.
dislikedText: Certaines salles de bain étaient dysfonctionnelles. La propreté des salles de bains pourrait être mieux.

likedText: Cama cómoda y habitación confortable.
dislikedText: Los baños y la cocina deberían estar más limpios.

likedText: Wij voelden ons thuis in House of Kadipaten.

dislikedText: Tidak ada
reviewTitle: Rumah pemginapan kumplit dan ramah kantong 😃

likedText: betah banget nginap disini, dekat pasar dan tempat makan enak, kamarnya bersih, ac nya dingin
Tempat nyaman, adem strategies. Bersih. Kl pun Kotor hanya sedikit kerak Di lantai kamar mandi
The location is gud
dislikedText: Overall is okay

likedText:
Las camas eran cómodas, la ubicación no estaba mal y el chico que nos recibió aunque no entendía ni español ni inglés intentó ser muy agradable. En todo momento tuve comunicación por chat con los dueños resolviendo mis dudas.
Si solo queréis ir a dormir rápido y no eres muy exquisito te puede valer.
dislikedText:
Tuvimos que separar chicas y chicos unos en una casa y otros en otra ya que no éramos familia pero están ambas casa unidas por una puerta interior. 
La casa le faltaba limpieza, los baños estaban bastante sucios, con algún bichito y las zonas comunes parecido.
El chico que nos recibe se queda en una habitación que hay en una de las casas en la planta baja.
reviewTitle: Suficiente pero sabiendo lo que esperar

likedText:
The location to Malioboro is about 300 metres. Staff are friendly. The male counter staff on night shift always put on a smile. 
The power point location are troublesome. No bed side power point. 
I charged my phone at the electric kettle. 
The best thing if you came back from shopping at Jl. Malioboro in the afternoon, they had prepared a cold water point free flow. But in the room there are no free mineral. On empty hug for you to refill near the lift landing. 
Along the road will find lot of Culinary.
I've tried few of them & to be honest the taste are lousy. Semarang Simpang Lima Culinary still the best.

likedText:
1. Strategic Location: The hotel is conveniently located, just a 5-minute walk to the Malioboro Area, making it easily accessible by foot. However, navigating by car can be cumbersome due to the one-way road system.
2. Spacious Rooms: The rooms are impressively spacious, providing ample room for guests.
3. Helpful Staff: The hotel staff proved to be helpful and responsive to requests throughout the stay.
4. Great Rooftop Bar and Pool: The rooftop bar and swimming pool offer a delightful experience, adding a positive touch to the overall ambiance.
dislikedText:
1. Room Cleanliness Issues: The initial room cleanliness left much to be desired, with dirt from the AC on the floor, smelly towels, and a moldy bathroom. It gave the impression that the maintenance was lacking.
2. High Price for Standard Facilities: During the peak season on 26-27 Dec, the pricing seemed disproportionately high for the standard facilities offered, raising concerns about value for money.
3. Limited Breakfast Options: The breakfast options were disappointingly limited, which may not align with guests' expectations.

likedText: Close to every were

likedText: One of the female staff members working in the restaurant/breakfast was very kind and helpful.
dislikedText:
For context, we have been travelling across SE Asia for 4 months now, staying in hotels, hostels, homestays etc ranging from no stars up to 5-star. Arriving at Prima In we were disgusted at the mould growing up the walls, the peeling wallpaper, the bed sheets covered in stains. There was a strong damp smell and just general dirt and stains everywhere. Whilst we moved rooms, the second one wasn’t much better but we were too tired to move again.
The bed was hard and we were only given 1 pillow each. When I asked for another pillow, they tried to charge me 30,000 per night. 
The walls are paper thin so you can hear everything. Your neighbours, down the corridor, floors above and below, outside etc. We were woken at 5 every morning by the call to prayer, then by kids in the pool at 6am (we were on floor 5). 
The room facilities were poor. The plug sockets and light switches were coming away at the wall. We had a broken lamp that we reported that was not replaced. No soap is provided in the bathroom and we had to ask for When we ate in the restaurant for dinner one night, the chicken I ate was not properly cooked and made me unwell. 
Location wise, you are close to Malioboro street, but not too close that you can hear it through the night. There are a lack of restaurants immediately nearby - you have to walk to Malioboro for this. You are also not close enough to walk to the palaces, we’d recommend staying further that way and absolutely avoiding this hotel.

La habitación no tiene la insonorizacion suficiente y se oyen los rezos y cualquier ruido del vecino de habitación.

likedText: Not a lot
dislikedText: We were not allowed to eat in the dining area in the evenings as it was Ramadan . We were told quite rudely to eat in our room or outside where no air con. We could not even get past the many many many people in the dining area eating their meal after fasting all day to get to the lift to our room. If hotel fully booked for Ramadan dinners then they should not take bookings for tourists or advise that this is the case. Breakfast was also left overs as all the people eating for Ramadan also were up early to eat. Me as a westerner had eggs only. The actual room was clean though very very small. No room for suitcases etc. extremely disappointed . I cannot believe the so called reviews were genuine. I will never recommend this hotel for non locals.
reviewTitle: This hotel doesn’t consider non local tourists at all. Not happy at all!

likedText: It`s a fantastic hotel. The location is very good, close to Malioboro Street, shopping, dining and all important attractions. The entire staff is fantastic, exceptionally kind and helpful in everything. Special thanks to Zulaikhah. The breakfast is fantastic, with a wide selection, as soon as it starts to run out, it is refilled immediately. The hotel's kitchen is very good, with 24-hour room service, it's worth having dinner here. The bed is very comfortable. The wifi worked well throughout the hotel . The rooftop pool area is very pleasant. The hotel is very child-friendly, especially recommended for small children.

likedText: Lokasi strategis, ke Malioboro atau ke pasar ngasem bisa dengan jalan kaki, value for money, staff dan pemilik rumah sangat ramah, saat kami menginap AC nya tidak dingin but its okay mungkin karena kami menginap berlima dlm satu kamar jadinya agak panas. Air panas tersedia, Kopi/teh tinggal seduh. Pokok'e Worthed lah.

Lokasi Hotel Strategis jalan kaki ke Malioboro lewat gang kecil, Hotel bersebelahan dengan Masjid.

Fasilitas ada Teh, kopi Gula Air panas, Dispenser di lorong.

Pelayanan Ramah, Fasilitas TV dgn setobox, Pemanas Air mandi, AC, Handuk, Harga Ekonomis.
dislikedText:
Bangunan Hotel bersatu dengan rumah pemilik, sehingga masuk hotel serasa masuk rumah orang, di ruang tamu sering di pakai buat tuan rumah dan tamunya ngobrol jadi agak sungkan kalo sering2 lewat karena lewat nya di tengah2 orang ngobrol yang berhadapan.

Sepatu sendal di lepas di depan hotel walau tidak hilang tapi rawan tertukar dengan tamu lain kalo buru2 atau anak2 yang pakai sendal.

Dapet Kamar yang AC nya berisik bunyinya keras pada outdoor dan indoor nya, 

Kamar mandi tidak di lengkapi 'exhouse fan' jadi ketika abis ada yang PUP bau nya ke ruang kamar. 

Lemari tidak bisa di tutup jadi harus pakai Karet di sangkutin, 

Di kolong Ranjang Kasur berdebu banget sepertinya jarang di berssihkan jadi buat yang Alergi debu berasa banget.
reviewTitle: Menyenangkan untuk Singgah istirahat buat yang liburan.

likedText: Lovely location and nice breakfast buffet
dislikedText: Very small rooms,
reviewTitle: Room maintenance could be better, and noise from the bar at late nights becomes irritating

likedText: The staff from the begging helped us, they made our time in Yogyakarta very easy. The location is really good, very close to Malioboro street but in a quiet side street. dislikedText: The room needs maintenance, mostly the bathroom. The bathroom wasn’t very clean. There was no hair dryer and I had to wait until the next day, because it’s necessary to wait your turn in a waiting list. It’s very difficult to sleep peacefully because the whole city wakes up at 4:00 am to pray. We could even hear the alarm of the people next to our room at 4:00 am every night (But this is a city issue)

likedText: I came there by Train from Jakarta. Since the first day I arrived both couple let me checked-in early morning even tho my check-in time initially was at 2pm. Very warm welcoming. always serving me a coffee(Pak udi always guessed no sugar ya?) and some yummy fresh fritters made by Bu Ning. Place a bit hidden but once you own the blocks, easy to remember. has place if you come with scooter. they even introduced me to their daughter and shared places must-visit. a bit on the countryside. all was worth if you’re a nature enthusiast. will come back for sure to this homestay! I love them!! Jogja❤️my future home🏡
reviewTitle: Very warm welcoming, pleasant and easy access

likedText:
The owner is really friendly and kind.

You close by the center

dislikedText:
The pictures are not really like the real room

Outside the garden is lovely 
Lovely Market during the day 
At night its not so nice to walk there, dirty and rats
Also there is a smell because the people from the market put there rubbish in a corner... 

The matress is comfortable but the bed is a bit runed
Also bathroom doesn't look like the pictures

Walls should be painted. Bit moldy 
And some tiny spiders If you are afraid. 

But for the price its OK.
The Lady is really a nice person.

likedText: Close to everywhere. Clean, AC doing great, Toilet is clean
dislikedText: None

likedText:
Great place! You're not going to get a lower priced place to stay right in the centre (7 mins walk to the main shopping street). It's a very basic room, but if you're like me and can sleep anywhere and don't mind the occasional mosquito, etc, then this is great for you.

 Also, it's right in the middle of an awesome little village, with such kind-hearted people who I met and spoke to everyday. It's a really safe and friendly neighborhood there. If you want a more authentic experience rather than staying in a city hotel, this is the better choice, especially for the price. Udi is an amazing guy too, making me coffee and fried banana every morning, also doing me other favours!

You're also right next to so many street shops and food, which are so cheap! I rented a scooter during my stay and it was so cool driving down and seeing the little side streets that lead to this homestay. The kids would always stop me to greet and say hello

I also enjoyed having the cats around, they're really friendly
dislikedText: The homestay isn't on Google maps and Grab, so you have to put something else nearby. I always used 'Bakmi Pak Man' haha. Not really something I didn't like but thought I'd write it here.
reviewTitle: Amazing family in a really convenient location and friendly neighbourhood

We appreciate your feedback regarding breakfast, and we will certainly take it into consideration to improve our variety of food. Regarding early check-in, it is available with an additional charge and subject to room availability. Please feel free to check with our team in advance for arrangements.

As part of our commitment to reducing plastic waste, we no longer provide bottled mineral water in guestrooms. However, we have water dispensers available in the corridor for guests’ convenience.

We truly appreciate your valuable input and look forward to welcoming you again on your next visit to Yogyakarta.

Best regards,
Aveta Hotel Malioboro Management

likedText: Excellent location and relation quality/price
propertyResponse:
Dear Manuel, 
Thank you for your perfect score and positive review! We are delighted to know that you are satisfied with our location and the quality of service that matches the price.

We look forward to welcoming you back to Aveta Hotel Malioboro on your next visit.

Best regards,
Aveta Hotel Malioboro Management

likedText: The room was big and spacious and a big comfortable bed. Complementary snacks and drinks were an added bonus and the staff were super friendly and helpful. It’s also in a great location which gets busy at night with a great atmosphere. Breakfast was very varied and good quality as well as the restaurant below was nice also.
dislikedText: Some noise from adjoining room but not a big deal still got good night sleep.
propertyResponse:
Dear Jack,

Thank you for sharing your experience and for giving us a great rating! We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our spacious room, comfortable bed, and the little extras like complimentary snacks and drinks. It’s also wonderful to know that our friendly staff, varied breakfast, and prime location added to your positive stay.

We appreciate your feedback regarding the noise from the adjoining room. While we’re glad it didn’t affect your rest, we will certainly take this into account to ensure even greater comfort for our guests in the future.

We hope to welcome you back soon for another enjoyable stay at Aveta Hotel Malioboro!

Best regards,
Aveta Hotel Malioboro Management

likedText: Brilliant, very good, varied and well presented
dislikedText: 2nd floor room had no view.
reviewTitle: Another good memory of Jogyakarta, will return
propertyResponse:
Dear Clive,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay, especially our well-presented and varied offerings. Your kind words truly mean a lot to us!

Regarding your feedback on the room view, we understand that a scenic view can enhance the overall experience. Our Executive rooms on the 2nd floor do have balconies, but due to their location, the view is partially obstructed. For future visits, please feel free to let us know your preferences, and we will do our best to accommodate you in a room that better suits your expectations.

We truly appreciate your valuable feedback and look forward to welcoming you again at Aveta Hotel Malioboro!

Best regards,
Aveta Hotel Malioboro Management

likedText:
Staff happily moved us, as there was a connecting door to the next room  and  they were noisy. Large bedrooms with comfy bed.very clean. Liked the water dispenser on all floors. Saved buying bottled, and cut down on plastic bottles. Pool was nice on top floor.
 Food in restaurant was really good, and nice to have a beer with it. Situated in a busy location, plenty of shops, and taxis
dislikedText: Nothing. It's a good hotel and value for money.
propertyResponse:
Dear Sharon, 
Thank you for your wonderful review! We’re glad our team could assist in making your stay more comfortable. It’s great to hear you enjoyed the spacious and clean rooms, water dispensers, rooftop pool, and delicious food at our restaurant. We appreciate your kind words and look forward to welcoming you back to Aveta Hotel Malioboro!

Best Regards,

Aveta Hotel Malioboro

likedText: Staff were friendly and helpful, location is great, room was clean and comfort. The entrance of the hotel is not in Main Street but easy to access.
dislikedText: Breakfast options could be more, basically it has all categories like western, hot meal, eggs, but for each category the choice was not that much

likedText: Nice room
propertyResponse:
Dear Eddie,

likedText: The hotel is strategically located at Jalan Malioboro, a happening street in Yogyakarta. Along this road, there are many outlets specialising in snacks, batik, souvenirs, some restaurants and also pharmacies.  The breakfast at the hotel is good too, I always look forward to it. The spread is not a lot but I got what I wanted to eat especially Gudeg Yogyakarta that I tried for the first time.
propertyResponse:
Dear Radzi, 
Thank you for sharing your experience with us! We’re delighted to know that you enjoyed our strategic location at Jalan Malioboro, surrounded by vibrant shops, restaurants, and local specialties. It’s wonderful to hear that our breakfast, especially the Gudeg Yogyakarta, left a positive impression on you. We hope to welcome you back for another enjoyable stay in the future!

Best regards,
Aveta Hotel Malioboro Management

likedText: The location
dislikedText:
I recently stayed at this hotel, and it was a nightmare from start to finish. The room was filthy, with mould on the bathroom ceiling, dusty surfaces, and an overpowering artificial fragrance clearly masking the lack of proper cleaning. When I complained, the front desk manager was shockingly unprofessional and dismissive, even mocking my concerns.

They showed us an alternative room with yellow, dirty walls and promised to repaint it. The result? A room reeking of fresh paint fumes, which they expected us to accept. The conditions were not just unpleasant but outright unhealthy, and the front desk manager’s attitude made everything worse.

As my complaints were ignored, I contacted Booking.com for help, and while they managed to settle a compensation, the hotel management retaliated by demanding we check out at 11 PM - something I’ve never experienced before! Ultimately, we stayed until the early morning, just to escape this dreadful place.
propertyResponse:
Dear Michel, 
Thank you for sharing your feedback.

We sincerely apologize for the experience you described during your stay. This is not reflective of the standards we strive to maintain, and we deeply regret the discomfort and inconvenience you faced. Cleanliness, professionalism, and guest satisfaction are top priorities for us, and it is clear we fell short in this instance.

Your comments regarding the cleanliness of the room, the handling of your concerns, and the alternative room offered have been taken very seriously.

Best Regards, 
Aveta Hotel Malioboro

likedText:
The only hotel that provide 3 single bed in 1 room 😁 so its perfect for our family.
Location is perfect right in the middle of the busy street so you can park the car and take a walk. Many becak too
Breakfast is ok, not the best.
dislikedText:
NO WINDOWS in the room!! 
There is a door thru the balcony but the reception person said if i booked 2 rooms it will be connected to the room next door then they will be able to open the balcony door. Didnt make sense since i know they renovating the room next door so its empty. The door has frosted glass so we had 0 view and no sunshine.
Parking is a bit tricky, you have no choice other than vallet. The hotel is located in the middle of the malioboro st, and they closed the street from 6pm to 9pm for pedestrians. Not very convinient. 
Bathroom could be cleaner.
propertyResponse:
Dear Laurensia, 
Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback. We’re delighted to hear that our unique room setup with three single beds and our central location were highlights for your stay. It’s wonderful to know that you enjoyed the convenience of exploring Malioboro Street on foot and the availability of traditional transportation like becak.

We sincerely apologize for the aspects that did not meet your expectations. Regarding the room's balcony door and lack of natural light, we will review our room configurations to ensure clarity and comfort for our guests. Your comments about bathroom cleanliness and parking convenience are also noted for immediate improvement.

We understand the challenges with the pedestrian-only hours on Malioboro Street and the valet-only parking arrangement, as these are influenced by city regulations. However, we’ll continue to strive for better solutions to enhance the guest experience.

Thank you for bringing these points to our attention. We hope to welcome you and your family back for an even better stay in the future.

Best regards,
Aveta Hotel Malioboro Management

likedText: great hotel staff were excellent  when there was a problem it was fixed straight away  very comfortable
dislikedText: everything  great
propertyResponse:
Dear Paul, 
We truly appreciate your wonderful feedback! It’s fantastic to know that you found everything great, and that our team was quick to resolve any concerns to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

We hope to host you again soon for another enjoyable experience at Aveta Hotel Malioboro.

Kind regards,
Management of Aveta Hotel Malioboro

likedText: Access to shopping center
dislikedText:
The location is great however you should think twice if you stay on weekend, the access to hotel is closed and you have to reroute to the other way full of traffic. Malioboro on weekend is chaos.
I book a room with king bed, turned out they use 2 single beds together to made a king bed. 
Also, this is my first time staying in a hotel and gets charged for request extra towell. It cost 50K/day.
reviewTitle: Im not very happy staying in this hotel.
propertyResponse:
Dear Annisa, 
Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. We are glad you found the hotel’s location convenient for shopping. Regarding the weekend road closures, we would like to explain that these are part of the local government’s efforts to manage traffic flow and reduce congestion in the Malioboro area. While it may cause some temporary inconvenience, it’s meant to benefit the overall traffic situation in the long run.

We apologize for the issue with the bed setup and will make sure to provide clearer details about room configurations in the future. Additionally, the charge for extra towels is a part of our hotel’s policy, which may vary from other establishments, and special requests are granted based on availability.

We look forward to your next visit and hope to offer a more seamless experience.

Best regards,
Aveta Hotel Malioboro Management

likedText: Clean and drinking water is provided via a dedicated water dispenser
dislikedText: Bathroom needs a better maintenance; commode’s bidet is not properly functional, the squirt mechanism needs lubricants or replaced
propertyResponse:
Dear Douglas, 
Thank you for your review and valuable feedback.
We are glad you appreciated the cleanliness and the drinking water dispenser. Regarding the bathroom maintenance, we truly regret the inconvenience with the bidet. We will prioritize resolving the issue and ensure the functionality is restored. Your comments will certainly help us improve the quality of our facilities.

We hope to have the opportunity to serve you better on your next visit.

Best regards,
Aveta Hotel Malioboro Management

likedText: Its location, right in the centre of Malioboro Street, surrounded by shops selling food, souvenirs, batik clothing, and so many other things…
dislikedText: There was no hand held shower in the bathroom. There were no hand towels provided, only bath towels. Amenities provided were only toothbrushes and a shower cap. The hotel charges you if you ask for an additional towel. Also Malioboro Street gets claustrophobically crowded in the day time and even worse in the evening.
reviewTitle: Despite its location, I would stay elsewhere next time.
propertyResponse:
Dear Arief, 
Thank you for taking the time to provide your review. We’re pleased that our central location on Malioboro Street allowed you to enjoy the bustling shopping and dining scene.

We regret to learn that certain aspects of your stay, such as the bathroom facilities, amenities, and towel policy, did not meet your expectations. Your feedback is valuable, and we will use it to reassess and improve our offerings.

Malioboro’s vibrant atmosphere can indeed be overwhelming during peak hours, and we appreciate your understanding of the area’s dynamic nature. We hope to welcome you back and provide a better experience in the future.

Best regards,
Management of Aveta Hotel Malioboro

likedText:
Aveta is totally underrated for a 3 star hotel. It's interior is exceptionally clean & classy (do not get fooled by how it looks from the outside) Staffs were helpful & friendly to guests & prompt to assist. Was very impressed Kudos!

Rooms were spacious. Beds were extremely comfy and pillows came with two choices of comfortness (soft & slight more support). Had a water dispenser in our rooms (hot, room temp. cold) & one of our rooms even have a Nescafe Expresso machine!

Being just along the famous Malioboro street means you are just steps away from Malioboro Mall and other amenities e.g pharmacy, convenience store. Didn't have much of a view from the rooms but doesn't really bother us much since our mornings & afternoons are packed with activities around Yogyakarta.
dislikedText: Due to peak season, I didn't get a proper ironing board (but I got an iron).
propertyResponse:
Dear Mohamad, 
Thank you for your kind words and for highlighting so many positive aspects of your stay at Aveta Hotel Malioboro. We’re delighted that you found our interior, cleanliness, and amenities, such as the water dispenser and Nescafe Espresso machine, to your liking. It’s wonderful to hear that our central location on Malioboro Street made it easy for you to explore Yogyakarta.

We appreciate your understanding regarding the ironing board during the busy season and will strive to improve. We hope to have the pleasure of hosting you again soon!

Best regards,
Management of Aveta Hotel Malioboro

dislikedText: In the afternoon, you may hear **chanting of prayers** from the nearby mosque. Additionally, the bathroom does not have a sink, which may be inconvenient for brushing your teeth and washing your face. Please also note that slippers are not provided, and the floor can be quite cold, so it's best to bring your own for a more comfortable stay.

This apartment was super comfortable and clean. The whole building was built not long ago and fairly new.

The room was spacious and I got to have a glimpse into the other room as well. The room had its sofa. They all looked very nice, comfortable, spacious and clean.

The host is very kind and helping whatever need you have.

The location is near the Alun Alun Park where there are many food stalls and LED car-cycles.

ATM and supermarket just across the street and there are many food places as well.

The host even provides motorbike and car rentals.

It was a great stay and definitely will book this again when back in Yogyakarta.

likedText: Breakfast - good selection of rice noodles drinks. Eggs on request. Rooms and facilities all look like the photos and no complaints on that front. Location is as described a quite long 20 minute walk from Malioboro and Grab taxis were needed to get to most recommended spots in the city.
dislikedText: Once again the booking.com reviews were accurate - absolutely fine hotel and meets expectations but you will be woken up by call to prayer at 4.30am and the mosque was directly outside of our window. We asked to move rooms but the staff did not have any alternatives and didn’t follow up with us. As a result we checked out early but no one asked why.
