likedText: The hotel was a 20 min walk from Malioboro markets, which is the main tourist area in Yogyakarta. The staff were friendly and spoke English which made the check in process much easier. The room was clean and the overhead shower was very nice.
dislikedText: The food was pretty salty and ordering room service was difficult. We called the extension number 2 times and no one picked up. Considering we called around dinner and no one picked up? I was just confused so I had to get my sister to order from the restaurant

likedText: The staff were very welcoming and friendly, the rooms were clean and as described.
reviewTitle: Good value for money and friendly staff

likedText:
Amazing service!!

After staying in many of boutiques hotels in Indonesia this is easily the best place my parents have stayed.

The service is truly world class and the all staff go above and beyond. We could write numerous stories of how they went above and beyond but your really need to experience for yourself.

I booked for my parents who come to Jogja to celebrate his 70th birthday and he was surprised by the real hospitality from all the team who turned up to congratulate him in the most genuine way.  

Special thank you to Pak Beka and the entire team of Hotel Ayaarta for making my father’s birthday and stay even more special. He already planned to return soon :)

Amazing value.
but overall all staff friendly, parking lot just ok,, location is super nice.. breakfast just ok,
dislikedText: well,, we travel for 2 adults and 1 kids 8yo, we require 3 towel and 1 additional pillow, but it turns out charged for around 3dollars for the pillow and 2dollars for the towel. if the towel is good we dont mind for it but actually the towel was also torn and lousy one.. so i decide it thanks but no thanks.. we can survive with those.. hahahaa.. perhaps if the front desk telling in sweet way for instance,, "due to we support the climate and water suistanability bla bla bla,, therefor we are sorry to charge this bla bla bla... then the customer can re re re reconsider.. to take it even it was charged.. but they just oh,, add some,, then you need to pay for ... " (this is the first time for me for being charged anyway,, #Shocked) bottom of bedroom was not clean up, so many dust.. i stay there for 4 days... come on.. and there are no welcome drink or else.. poor support when we would rather have not twin bed,, because the bed cannot be put together.. #classic but we need it though..
reviewTitle: just ok and nice, stay there again ? 1-5 maybe i rate 2

likedText: Location and price is acceptable. Breakfast is good and satisfying for us
dislikedText: Maybe if the price is included with breakfast? I will come again

likedText: Great room and fairly central location.
dislikedText: Bit too much early morning noise - cockerel at 05:00 and home stay people chatting and starting mopeds outside the room didn’t help.

likedText: Price

likedText: Nic,všude nepořádek na dvorku
dislikedText: Všude na dvoře neporadek

likedText: V ubytování byla terasa,dalo se tam posedět s kávou,která byla volně k použití v hotelu,všude na chodbách i v pokoji čisto.Recepce neumí jazyky,špatná domluva

likedText: Lokasi tengah kota

likedText: A great place to experience living in Yogyakarta for several days in a traditional house. A very good location, 15 minutes walk from the hussle and bustle of the city centre. A nice neighbourhood on its own with little shops, cafes and local restaurants. We enjoyed our short stay.
dislikedText: The kitchen and bathroom were not really clean. It's a pity because the house is very nice and could be improved with more care and maintanace of details.
reviewTitle: A plesant stay in a traditional house of Yogyakarta in a nice neighbourhood.

likedText: It’s a very big house and you can go walking to the main atractions and street.

Owner was super helpful 
He provided us with extra mattress.

Perfect for 2 to 4 people. The tiny garden was my favourite place in the whole house. Its very nice if you want to drink your morning coffee with a view. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. One of the bedrooms and the dining cum kitchen overlooked the garden. Very good architectural design so as to maximise use of natural sunlight. Loved the coloured glass panes at the entrance. It was perfect for me and my mother and very close to the kings palace and mailoboro street. Overall, was a little bit of home away from home. Ario, the caretaker was really helpful and available at all hours of he day, ever ready to help. I will definitely come back again since you can also cook your own Food.
dislikedText: There Was tea coffee and sugar however, Would be great if some salt could be provided because we found it a bit difficult to buy small portions of salt. Ario helped us with a suggestion and only then we found it. The drawing cum kitchen room could use a stronger fan..
reviewTitle: Amazing and homely stay in Jogja. Will be back next year!!

likedText:
Spacious house with also spacious rooms and bathrooms. Comes with all the amenities like soap, shampoo and towels. Really suitable for family with 2 children. Tea, Coffee, sugar also provided. Would be great if saucepan is also provided, just to cook some instant noodles.
Parking space is a little bit tricky, but once you get the hang of it, it's not really that hard to park your car.

Another input, would be great if you also provide bicycle, to roam the city.
dislikedText:
Parking space is a little bit tricky, but once you get the hang of it, it's not really that hard to park your car.

Another input, would be great if you also provide bicycle, to roam the city in the morning.

likedText: bedrooms and bathrooms are spacious, clean and comfortable
dislikedText: a bit challenging to park the car

likedText: 房子很漂亮，鐵門進去後有兩三戶房子之中的其中一戶。兩房兩衛浴一客廳。其中一間房間是套房。有簡單廚房（但我們沒有使用）。有冰箱，還有一個小庭院（天井）。
dislikedText: 洗澡蓮蓬頭水非常小。一開始還跳電（房東說是因為兩台冷氣跟熱水器的關係），後來知道後就沒發生了。

likedText: tempatnya enak banget, fasilitas lengkap, semuanya ada
dislikedText: gak ada, semua enak untuk 4 orang

likedText: Sangat amat nyaman staycation di serasa rumah. Dekat dengan objek wisata. Kalau ke Jogja pasti akan booking di serasa rumah lagi. Terima kasih admin....
Замечательное расположение в старом городе, недалеко от достопримечательностей. Местную еду можно купить недалеко. Отдельный просторный дом, тихо. Хозяин оставил 2 большие бутыли с водой.
Lokasi bagus berada di tengah kota dekat dengan alun alun dan banyak wisata kuliner fasilitas rumah sangat lengkap mantap
dislikedText: Akses untuk parkir mobil kurang luas agak masuk dari jalan
reviewTitle: Fasilitas rumah sangat lengkap benar benar serasa tinggal di rumah sendiri

likedText: We loved staying in this authentic Javanese home enjoying the hospitality of a very gracious hostess and the chance to meet local guests. Nothing like sitting in a covered verandah enjoying a tropical Javanese evening. For a little extra she made us a beautiful breakfast with freshly squeezed fruit juices and great coffee. Easy Grab ride to excellent restaurants and city centre. Take time away from hotels for a special Javanese experience.
reviewTitle: A special memory of Javanese hospitality

likedText: Very authentic old java culture Hause , very green cozy and beautiful architecture.Nice and kind personal who work at that house , was really nice stay with my family. Sure will. Be back again when in Yogyakarta:)
House in its entirety is a gem.
reviewTitle: Fantastic place, great location, excellent host!

likedText: Traditional, beautiful furniture
dislikedText: Quite noisy

likedText: Simple traditional and match the pictures
dislikedText: Nothing
reviewTitle: Worth the price traditional homey accommodation

likedText: Friendly and helpful owner. Can brew tea or coffee if asked. Localization is good for tourists. House looks very good compared to the neighborhood, but it is old and you can see it. Lots of chickens, pigeons and cats that can wake you up but overall good place for few nights. I really liked traditional furniture. Can recommend.

Authentic villa in style & colors of the Yogya sultan palace, filled with original furniture. Very friendly lady of the house gave us afternoon coffee and breakfast and helped with the theater performances etc. Highly recommended.
dislikedText: All good

likedText: The building is so beautiful and the location is great but the thing that made the stay magical for me was the host. She was so helpful, kind and amazing. Terima kasih banyak!
reviewTitle: Charming stay in a historic building close to attractions

likedText: Small property but very spacious. Verandah perfect for relaxing after sightseeing. Very friendly host
dislikedText: I would have preferred a ceiling fan in the room but it has updated with air con
reviewTitle: Yogya secret oasis cd at en nu TC

likedText: Beautiful house with nice furniture in traditional style a peaceful terrace. Nice host. Perfect location for visiting the city, many cute restaurants nearby.
dislikedText: The bathroom was very basic and very small. The mosque was right besides the room and very loud. The bathroom window couldn't properly be closed, so a lot of mosquitos came in.
reviewTitle: A great place to discover Yogja, but bring earplugs

likedText: Helpful staff and nice ambiance. The
dislikedText: Room size definitely smaller than listed and pictures look much nicer than rooms in reality. That doesn’t mean it is bad, but just wanted to point it out!

likedText: I recently stayed at this beautiful colonial hotel and was truly enchanted. The vintage furniture and exquisite decorations created an atmosphere that felt like stepping into a museum. Every corner was filled with character and charm. The highlight of my stay was the super kind lady working there; her warmth and hospitality made me feel right at home. If you're looking for a unique and welcoming experience, this hotel is an absolute gem!
dislikedText: This beautiful place is for the ones who appreciate authentic javanese culture. if you look for big hotels luxuty..this is not the place. It has a special javanese style. .

likedText: This guesthouse offers a cozy, homey atmosphere in a great location. The friendly hosts make the stay special with their exceptional kindness and hospitality. The traditional Javanese style adds unique character. With plenty of nearby warungs offering cheap and tasty meals, it's a convenient and authentic place to stay. Overall, the warm service and cultural charm make this guesthouse a good choice.
dislikedText: Some areas, like the bathroom and squeaky beds, could use a refresh.

likedText: Great location, great classic Indonesian style facility. Excellent host
dislikedText: Nothing

likedText: The colonial look and feel of the house is splendid

Super friendly host and super comfortable stay. I bothered them quite frequently for help, and they always response immediately and solve the problem rapidly. Feel like at home, but I can't really afford such a luxury home:) 
 Highly recommend!

Very good host. Feeling warm welcome. Offering welcome coffee at the front of yard (on the photo), eating breakfast in their salon is even feeling like as  “nobility family”. House is old, wall is thin, shower system is old, YET very nice precious old house. Love the atmosphere.  In the middle of town. Feeling local. (And price too. Appreciated)
reviewTitle: Like, coming back to my grand parents noble house.

likedText: 这个民宿有100年历史，是典型的印尼民居，装饰风格有历史感，陈列了一些传统乐器，庭院不大但舒适漂亮。离皇宫不远，步行十分钟可达。不方便的是附近没有啥餐馆。老板娘很热情，帮我预约了第二天的包车寺庙游。
dislikedText: 房间洗手间无窗，抽风机声音很大，洗漱及毛巾质量一般。

likedText:
Hübsche javanische Ville in guter Lage, um Kraton und Taman Sari zu besuchen.
Wir wurden sehr herzlich von der Gastgeber empfangen und versorgt. Jeden Nachmittag gab es einen leckeren Tee oder Kaffee.
dislikedText:
Zimmer ist etwas in die Jahre gekommen (wie bei vielen Unterkünften in Indonesien) - Hauptsache es war alles sauber :)
Packt außerdem Ohrstöbsel ein!

likedText:
Heel persoonlijk en authentiek. De kamer was prima  (lekker rustig!!) en de gastvrouw echt een pareltje. Ze praat een beetje Engels zodat ze ons kon helpen met het regelen van vervoer naar de tempels. 
Ze maakte een lekker ontbijtje voor ons klaar met toast, omelet, jam, vers vruchtensap en vers fruit.
reviewTitle: Als je van authentiek en origineel houdt een absolute aanrader.

likedText: Tolles Ambiente, sehr freundliche Gastgeberin, schönes altes Haus. Zimmer werden täglich geputzt

住這兒可以體驗舊時貴族生活

reviewTitle: Great place to stay with good location and the best staff

likedText: Staff was very kind and they allowed us to get assess to our room 2h ahead of check-in time. The place is very simple but clean. The room was spacious and the mattress was ok. Just make sure you bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper since the AC our room was noisy.
dislikedText: The plunge pool shown in the pictures doesn’t actually exist as a pool, it’s a pond in the common area.

likedText: Good location, comfy amd clean rooms, small but delicious breakfast and really really friendly staff! Tyas is the best! :) If we ever come back to Jogja, we’ll definitely stay here.
Wonderful hostel: in a lovely area, with a super friendly staff, ask them if you need help with anything!
Friendly and helpful Staff
dislikedText: Payment method
reviewTitle: The payment method can be improved

likedText: Everything was perfect: clean, cozy, well-organised, delicious breakfast, cheap. A special thank goes to Tyas, she’s the best host: kind, smart, ready to help out… thank you for making my staying so special!
It was great! Beautiful building, lovely staff, comfortable room, delicious breakfast, good location.
dislikedText: Nothing!!

likedText: Atmosphere was very cosy. Very friendly staff and delicious breakfast. Beds were comfortable. Spacious lockers. Bathroom was clean
dislikedText: Sheets and towels had some stains. Upper beds were difficult to climb in to. The patio had no roof, which is nice for the atmosphere but after rain the floor is wet when you want to go to the bathroom

likedText: The cleanliness and the location is the best parts. The most concerning part of a guesthouse is its cleanliness, and this place is amazing.
dislikedText: My locker was a little hard to close. But it worked after a few tries. The blank was thin but they provided extra blankets

likedText: A great location. Quiet, but very handy for a visit to the Kraton (Palace). The bed was very comfortable, the staff were delightful and very helpful. The breakfasts were lovely - we chose the local ones which were delicious. The wifi was fine and worded well. We'd certainly stay again.
dislikedText: Nothing of any substance. The place suited our needs perfectly.
reviewTitle: A lovely period home with good facilities in a quiet area of town that's handy for the royal palace.

likedText: Near keraton, cozy home, good breakfast, friendly host, 24 hrs front desk. Fast respons. Thankyou Mbak Tyas and Mas (sorry i forgot his name)..
dislikedText: None

likedText: Staff was so nice and so helpful! I forgot my Blanket and they send it via post to my next Hotel! Very quite and peaceful Place so nice sleep :)
Breakfast was really nice, home made everyday. The patio and the design looks really nice.
dislikedText: The pool is not so big as it look from images, but still lovely to see it and to chill around.
reviewTitle: The Patio Yoga is a really nice place to stay, price/ value totally worth it. Location is nice and quite, Staff is v

likedText: It's located in a safe and quiet location that is super close to the Keraton and a few minutes away from Malioboro street. There are cafes and restaurants nearby too. The hostel is cosy and the staff like Kak Tyas are kind, friendly and helpful! Breakfast is available daily for 30k rupiah (includes fruits and tea/coffee). You can also book tours or scooter rides to Borobudur etc via the hostel.
dislikedText: The hostel is slightly hidden in a narrow walkway so it could be slightly inconvenient if you would like a direct drop off from Grab or Gojek car. The room has no window so ventilation might not be the best (unless you leave the doors open for awhile). And the lock is also old fashioned so some might not feel secured. But these are just small issues and there are certainly more pros than cons (:

likedText:
Location is perfect, you can easily walk to popular highlights. 
The food was crazy delicious, best breakfast I ever had. The is also a beautiful small private patio/garden where you can sit. 
The rooms are super clean and cosy. 

We started with a reservation for two nights, but ended up longer (6 days total). 

We also did two early activities and they made us lunch boxes ever since time. 

I absolutely recommend!
dislikedText: Really bad WiFi, you need your own data

likedText: It's a cool and comfortable hostel. The ambience is really chilled. The manager and staff are extremely nice and helpful. Conveniently located in a central Area and walking distance to many prominent tourist attractions in the city.

The hostel itself is really like a hidden gem in the sultan’s palace area. The friendly people who worked there, as well as very nice travelers I met, the hearty breakfasts, all made the stay memorable. I have already recommend the place to my friends.

Very kind people. 
Cheap and very good!

For this kind of price, you can't really ask a lot, but they have exceeded all expectations. Very pleasing to the eye. good cleanliness. Friendly and helpful staffs. Would be a better choice to stay for solo or couple travellers than most if not all Airbnb apartments of the same price range. The inclusion of water heater for showering is most appreciated.
dislikedText: The AC in my room was evidently old. The sound it makes is pretty loud. Not a problem for me but it might be noteworthy for others. It does its job well in making the room cold though, so no problem there.
reviewTitle: Best Value and right in the central of Jogja

likedText: Tyas and the other staff were very friendly and helpful. Cosy place, loved the breakfast. Quiet at night, had good sleep.
dislikedText:
Some mosquitoes in the area but can’t be avoided.
The toilet had a smell at times and the hole clogged up quite a bit. If that can be improved, would’ve been a brilliant stay.

likedText: I like the concept here. like staying at home. it reminds me of my friend's guesthouse. A sense of calm living here with a safe atmosphere.
dislikedText: The sink in the toilet too small. But it doesn't bother me at all.
reviewTitle: I will stay here again if I visit Jogja

likedText: Akbar was really nice and helpfull. Best banana pancake for breakfast! Located in a calm area, beautiful neighborhood
Nice, comfortable, clean, beautifull decorated guesthouse in a very quiet little street. Very friendly staff that speaks good English! Nice choices for breakfast.
Price
dislikedText: Room was full of mosquitos, spiders and humidity

likedText: Good location.
dislikedText: Not the cleanest or the most comfortable and only cold water.

likedText: The staff were all really friendly and someone was always on hand if you required them. Free hot and cold water always available. Courtyard area with seating was really handy and nice as it was sheltered. Great location within walking distance of main tourist attractions and fortunately for us a vegan, very cheap eatery round the corner as was a place to do laundry.
dislikedText: Although we know that you get what you pay for, the bathroom needs a little attention in terms of clearing previous occupants used products, removal of spiders and cobwebs from walls and ceiling... just a few minor details which could be easily rectified.
reviewTitle: You get what you pay for

likedText: The staff were all really friendly and someone was always on hand if you required them. Free hot and cold water always available. Courtyard area with seating was really handy and nice as it was sheltered. Great location within walking distance of main tourist attractions and fortunately for us a vegan, very cheap eatery round the corner as was a place to do laundry.
dislikedText: Although we know that you get what you pay for, the bathroom needs a little attention in terms of clearing previous occupants used products, removal of spiders and cobwebs from walls and ceiling... just a few minor details which could be easily rectified.
reviewTitle: You get what you pay for

likedText: The room has good facilities, bathroom is clean.
dislikedText: The hotel does not have restaurant facility
reviewTitle: Good, but could have been better

likedText: Nothing, everything was dirty and full of bugs
dislikedText: The rooms (we booked 3) were in a horrible state: stains in the bed, huge spiders, ants, lizards... The bathroom was completely disgusting.

likedText:
Il y avait de la moisissure (humidité) sur le plafond et sur les coussins. Sur la réservation, il était précisé un lit double et un lit simple dans l'annonce. On a eu droit à un lit double et un matelas au sol. 
Pas de lavabo dans la salle de bain de privative. 
Salle de bain pas très propre. 
Personnel pas très agréable.
Seul positif : la literie et la proximité avec le Kraton
dislikedText:
Odeur abominable dans la chambre, salle demain crasseuse, crasse incrusté dans le sol. Toilette immonde avec une cuvette plus que sale et sans rabat 
Pas de l'eau chaude comme mentionné 
Clim présente mais en mauvais état de fonctionnement
Chambre extrêmement poussiéreuse
Pas lewat koridor menuju kamar, ada toilet yang terbuka setengah, saya melihat ada makhluk hitam besar, saya kira itu jin, ternyata itu staf yang lagi BAK ga d ttup pintunya

likedText: Stafnya ramah2 terutama ownerhya baik sekali..seperti sedang d.rumah sendiri😁
dislikedText: Tv nya saja susah dinyalakan tapi ga apa2 overall bagus

likedText: Ibu nya baik banget
dislikedText: Tv nya blm bisa nyala tp gpp karna wifi ada jd bisa putar netflix

likedText: emplacement et café à côté
dislikedText: Très sale, personnel absent, en 5 nuits ma chambre n’a pas été faite une seule fois, photos mensongères, moisissures, salle de bain terrifiante.
reviewTitle: Fait l’exploit d’être très peu cher mais de quand même avoir un très mauvais rapport qualité prix.

likedText: Lits très confort.
dislikedText: Pas d’eau chaude. Pas mal de choses en mauvais état dans les chambres (prises, clim…).

likedText:
Locatie is goed. Dichtbij Sultan Paleis en heeft goed koffie tentje ernaast. Er is heet water voor koffie en thee beschikbaar.

Als je beetje tegen vies kan is het prima, bedden lagen goed en personeel is aardig.
dislikedText: Kamer stonk, erg vies, liepen mieren overal, schimmel en spinnenwebben in de badkamer.

likedText: Tempatnya bersih. Orang2nya ramah banget. Teh dan kopi gratis mau bikin kapanpun bebas. Mereka pelihara kucing, lucu lucu bangeet jadi buat hiburan sendiri. Di tempat parkirnya ada usaha coffee shopnya mereka. Tempatnya adem juga. Kamar rapih, bersih, kamar mandi dalem. Recommend enough for you to stay here👍🏼
dislikedText: Pintu kamar mandinya kurang rapat. Sebenernya gapapa sih, tapi kurang nyaman aja buat saya pribadi.

likedText: 位置不错，去皇后和博物馆都很方便，老板娘也很客气
dislikedText: 卫生间实在是没法待，马桶盖坏的，洗脸盆堵的，有蚂蚁有蟑螂

likedText: Für das Geld bekommt man alles was man braucht, aber auch nicht mehr.
Tempat g begitu jauh dari Malioboro
dislikedText: Air hangat tidak berfungsi

likedText: dekat dengan kota
The staffs are so friendly and nice. 😍😍😍😍
roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

likedText: The staffs are so friendly and nice. 😍😍😍😍
roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

likedText: the location is near Malioboro, walkable only couples hundred meters, the staff are friendly, its super clean for an affordable inn
dislikedText: none
roomInfo: Single Room with Shared Shower and Toilet

likedText:
Friendly and helpful staff. Very close to Malioboro as well as other points of interest. I walked to Taman Sari, Karaton, and Vredeburg. Just under an hour away from Prambanan and/or Ratu Boko by vehicle.
Pretty good microsite outlining how to get to attractions, local eating spots, etc.
Kitchen facilities, which were nice, since other places I've stayed at in Indonesia haven't had kitchens. Plus a supermarket a couple of streets away.
Good sized lockers under beds in the room, too.
dislikedText: People in my room didn't have hostel etiquette: constantly left the room door open, cranked the AC down to 16c overnight.
roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

likedText: good value of money! location strategic, walking distance to train station and malioboro street
Liked only the location.
dislikedText: Everything except the location was pretty bad, there is no 24 hour helpdesk, they are always greedy for the money 🤑.Rented a bike from them and the bike's tyre was totally worn out and we had two punctures, had to replace a new tube to continue our travel on the bike and received no refund from the hotel.They said u can take away your new tyre.Had to check in early and were charged on per person per hour basis which came out to a full day stay for just four hours of early check in.They are some psycho frauds.You feel like a slave in this hostel, rules written everywhere to follow.
reviewTitle: Never ever stay in this hostel.
propertyResponse: Thanks for sharing your thoughts, Sharma! We'll definitely consider adding a note to our booking process about early arrivals, so guests can plan accordingly. We understand that arriving at 6am morning and waiting for the previous guests to check out can be a bit of a challenge. It's always best to book check in 10April, when you are arriving 6am on 11April. Self check in access code do available 24H. We'll make sure to communicate our check-in&out policies more clearly to avoid any inconvenience in the future. Regarding the motorbike, we appreciate your feedback on our rental policies. We have reviewed our rental procedures, it was fair and transparent. Thanks again for your input, and we hope you enjoyed Yogyakarta.
roomInfo: Standard Double Room with Shared Bathroom

likedText:
Location is good
Decoration is very cool
dislikedText: I personally didnt like the layout of the room, there is no privacy between beds. Rooms were okay but every bathroom was very smelly and dirty. Also there were many bugs and flies on the walls in the bathrooms. Commune area is very cool but ventilation is bad, fan is not enough they need AC there
reviewTitle: Very cool place but not comfortable
roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

likedText: The location is good and the staffs are very responsive and friendly. The price is really affordable for a private room.
dislikedText: Sound insulation. You can hear people talking and walking around very clearly, almost like wall and door don't exist.
reviewTitle: Good value of money. Very friendly staffs.

likedText: Staying here for the 2nd time and it has always been a great experience. The location, the building, the facilities, and the staff are super!
reviewTitle: Comfy and cozy stay in Yogyakarta

likedText: Good location, kind staff, cute environment and good value for money
dislikedText: Don’t rent scooters with them because there are really old
roomInfo: Economy Quadruple Room with Shared Bathroom

likedText: Very cute property and good location
The accommodation was on a perfect location. The staff was very kind and we had a lot of space.

Very central location around malioboro street, easy to go anywhere and handy to find anything. From street food until supermarket. From traditional vehicle until an online apps, such as GO-JEK Grab maxim etc. You live like a local. Friendly surroundings and cozy like a home. All the staffs were great in servicing. We stayed at bunk bed and was amazing. Every bed has their own space and charging socket. Bed was even good too. Design of the house is unique and lovely. Would like to recommend my friends who'd like to visit Yogyakarta
dislikedText: Stock of coffee was runs out, staff didn't refilled them up, for the small thing needs the more details. Smal steps in through the room is little bit dangerous due to has no sign, especially for those who have an eye problem/ need to wear a glasses in the night, the color of the floor quite dark.
roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

likedText: The location, the bed

Good location 
Large lockable storage space
dislikedText:
Not the accommodations fault, but there was a power cut 
Could of been cleaner 
For the shared dorms 3 toilets and 2 showers
roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

likedText: The staff very friendly and helpful
roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

likedText: Good service, everything was super well organised, they even provided “A little Guidebook” to enjoy Yogya even more! The saff were super friendly and easy to reach via WhastApp. The property itself is interesting and turned into the accommodation with good taste. The common areas are chill, kitchen was well equipped, dorm was okay and the beds were comfortable. And the lockers for bags were huge! Perfect location, easy to reach and still really quiet during the nights.
dislikedText: There was no curtains in the dorm, so maybe a little lack of privacy might feel uncomfortable for some. For me it was not an issue.
reviewTitle: Super good stay, everything worked smoothly!
roomInfo: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

likedText: The place is very basic/alternative and yet extremely clean, efficient, good lighting in the room. The kitchen has pretty much everything you'd need to fix yourself a meal, plus free flow coffee&tea. I've spent 2 nights and my train left in the evening. The staff was so kind and stored my trolley after I completed the checkout
roomInfo: Standard Double Room with Shared Bathroom

likedText: Great location, close to Malioboro
dislikedText:
No hot water
Shower need a bit of maintenance
roomInfo: Single Room with Shared Shower and Toilet

likedText: The location is great and also the hostel. Small but more than one common area. Enough sinks, toilets and showers. The kitchen is useable. The AC is working good. The rooms are not that big but kind of comfty (minimalistic)
dislikedText: The first bathroom could need a refresh. The terrace in the backyard is nice but it would be better with a table and chairs (as on the pictures) also the common area on the balcony could need a refresh.
roomInfo: Standard Double Room with Shared Bathroom

likedText: Good place & suitable for backpackers
roomInfo: Single Room with Shared Shower and Toilet

likedText: We had the booking wrong and they were able to refund it! Staff was nice. They let us leave our luggage before checkin and after checkout. Good location to malioboro. Toilets were clean
reviewTitle: Nice and cheap place to visit best city in Java.

likedText: It was a great location and the room was very cool. Room is up very steep stairs so just be aware of that.
dislikedText: Nothing - for the money paid it was great

likedText:
The staff are amazing! They create a WhatsApp group to welcome you and they care to answer your questions. The location is just a little walk away from Malioboro and the design, in my opinion, is cozy cool and gives a good vibe.
They provide free water refill, coffee and tea. Also there is a shared kitchen and a place to put your clothes to dry (which is a plus for me :)
The room I booked had AC and fan. Both work very well and has proper light and reading light. It was cozy and had what I needed.
I would absolutely stay there again..
dislikedText: Nothing that I hated, but would be great to have more western toilets than just one.. But overall I wouldn't complain :)
propertyResponse:
Thank you for the kind words Mado. Ps: There's another western toilet next to the backgarden :)
We hope to see you again in Yogyakarta. Let's stay in touch via IG @yogyakartabnb.

likedText: the staff are friendly, the place are near by Malioboro street and quite accessible by car or motorcycle ride, the room are comfy just like my own bed room at home.
dislikedText: the shower flow are too slow, because its located near by street so you could heard vehicle sound passing by
propertyResponse:
Thank you for the review, Mochamad! It's always nice to know our guest feels like at home. Oh no, did you miss our waterfall shower next to the back garden? We you get to try them next time, okay ;)
Hope to see you again in Yogyakarta. Let's stay in touch via IG @yogyakartabnb.
roomInfo: Standard Double Room with Shared Bathroom

likedText: Amazing...good location, good facilities, good ambiance

A beautiful little guest house in a very nice neighbourhood in Jogja. A lovely garden with wooden furniture and many plants and birds - pleasing for both eyes and ears. The location is excellent, very close to the centre, and yet off the main road. Breakfast was delicious. Recommend for short stays.
dislikedText: The lighting in the bedroom was very poor and the bathroom is very small. For me the cushion was too high and hard.
reviewTitle: A beautiful little guest house in a very nice neighbourhood with a lovely garden.

likedText: Fair price, interesting decor and artifacts.
dislikedText: Looks better in the photos than it is.

likedText: 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘢𝘮𝘣𝘪𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘰𝘧 𝘰𝘳𝘪𝘨𝘪𝘯𝘢𝘭 𝘑𝘢𝘷𝘢𝘯𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘦 𝘰𝘭𝘥𝘩𝘰𝘶𝘴𝘦, 𝘧𝘶𝘭𝘭 𝘨𝘳𝘦𝘦𝘯𝘪𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘣𝘪𝘳𝘥𝘴 𝘴𝘰𝘶𝘯𝘥  (𝘴𝘰 𝘤𝘢𝘭𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘨),𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘧𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘯𝘥𝘭𝘺 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘧𝘧,  𝘸𝘢𝘳𝘮𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘰𝘸𝘯𝘦𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘨𝘭𝘦 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘢𝘭𝘭 𝘨𝘶𝘦𝘴𝘵𝘴 𝘢𝘴 𝘸𝘦𝘭𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘪𝘳 𝘰𝘸𝘯 𝘧𝘢𝘮𝘪𝘭𝘪𝘦𝘴, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘴𝘶𝘳𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘨𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵 𝘭𝘰𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘸𝘩𝘪𝘤𝘩 𝘤𝘭𝘰𝘴𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘗𝘢𝘭𝘢𝘤𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘮𝘰𝘴𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘵𝘰𝘶𝘳𝘪𝘴𝘮/𝘤𝘶𝘭𝘵𝘶𝘳𝘢𝘭 𝘰𝘣𝘫𝘦𝘤𝘵𝘴 (𝘸𝘢𝘭𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘤𝘦) 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘺 𝘢𝘭𝘴𝘰 𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘦𝘴 𝘶𝘴 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘑𝘢𝘷𝘢𝘯𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘦 𝘐𝘯𝘥𝘰𝘯𝘦𝘴𝘪𝘢𝘯'𝘴 𝘵𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘪𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘭 𝘣𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘬𝘧𝘢𝘴𝘵 (𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘦𝘪𝘨𝘯 𝘨𝘶𝘦𝘴𝘵 𝘤𝘶𝘭𝘪𝘯𝘢𝘳𝘺 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦𝘴)

likedText: The location is good, and I really feel like at home.
dislikedText: A little bit too old, may need some maintenance.

likedText: The guest house was very nice, homey and cozy with lots of beautiful antique furnitures. Located in quiet neighborhood, not far from the Alun Alun Utara. The sofa bed in the family room was quite old. One of the staff, an old man did a very excellent job. He made good white coffee every morning.
dislikedText: I had to find the front staff for check out, most of the time nobody was at the front desk. I guess cause they were in safe neighborhood.

likedText: Good location and the breakfast is basic but complete. The staff is very kind and helpful.
dislikedText: The neighbor’s rooster was a little bit noisy. But we only heard it one morning.
reviewTitle: Very good location in Yogyakarta. Near the principal attractions and interest points. We were meant to stay only 2 days

likedText:
Location is close to train station and walking distance to ,old Village  and all the landmarks including restaurants and shoping in the crazy Maliboro street . Otherwise plenty of local restaurants on the street.
 Pleasent cortyard with sitting area to relax or have breakfast. Birds are singing in the morning ,unfortunately caged . 
Rooms are clean, good size and beds are comfortable. 
Breakfast was traditional  from outside and it was OK.
The host was really nice to let us hang about after check out as our train was later in the evening
dislikedText: Not anything specific. Maybe It can help with a bit of update in the bathrooms.
reviewTitle: Pleasent and confortable one night stay close to everthing for good price.

likedText:
We are return guests.  This time got the biggest room for the night. 
Was comfortable and location is in a suburb close to palace and Maliboro st
dislikedText: Nothing to mention

likedText: Great location, walking distance to All surrounding attractions.  Historical home of past political importance, so it seemed.  Overall Pleasant
dislikedText: The bathroom is tiny and is a trip hazard getting in and out of shower
reviewTitle: Quiet, cozy and close to all

likedText:
Quite cheap and the location is quite good.
About 2km walk to water castle, museum, palace and malioboro street etc

Very friendly and nice staff 

The teak wood interiors are excellent 

I booked all my tours from the agent Rio assigned by the hotel and they did a brilliant job and the prices were lower than online prices
dislikedText:
Poor in terms of hygiene 

No hot water, just lukewarm water 

As it’s in ground floor inside the garden, the ants get inside the room
reviewTitle: Overall not bad for the price you pay

likedText: Location
The Full homestay in classic style, polite and nice staff.
Good location.
dislikedText: Hot water shower is only available between 5-7am, and 4-6pm. This is not mentioned in the room description from booking.com.

likedText: Good location, close to the Palace and other famous place of interest.
dislikedText: The hotel owner enforces a very unusual policy for hot water shower. It is only available for 4 hours a day, between 5-7am, and 4-6pm. If you come back late and missed the time frame, you can't take shower in hot water, which is extremely annoying. When it is available,  the hot water is barely enough for one person to complete the shower. The next person would have to wait another 30 minutes for the water to heat up again.

likedText: Staff, posizione
dislikedText: Bagno
reviewTitle: Super nice reception guy! They suggested a very good and honest driver to do tours in the nearby of Ubud

dislikedText: We got a dirty room with mold on the room walls…the communication in English was very difficult. We couldn’t stay there and left the guest house.

likedText: Had a great time staying there. Everything was perfect. Clean
propertyResponse: Ms. Norhidayah, thank you so much for staying with us. We’re so happy you enjoyed your time here. Stay well, take care. Sampai jumpa lagi! :)

likedText: The house, the situation, the room, the service are all good.
reviewTitle: It was worth it to stay @ Ndalem Maharani with my family because the location so strategies.

dislikedText:
We caught one of the employees red handed trying to steal in our room after lying to us that he needed to check the bathroom. 

no other employees were found to report the incident shortly after and before we checked out. We hope the owners checks the CCTV and do something about the culprit.
propertyResponse:
Ms. Shahfeena, I’m so grateful we were able to speak. Thank you for making yourself available. It was extremely important for us to do everything possible to make things right, and being able to listen to your experience helps us properly address the situation and put things into perspective. So, thank you so much once again.

We pride ourselves on kindness and integrity, and our family-run business means the world to us and our humble employees. We hope to be able to keep providing a warm, lovely home to anyone visiting our special town. 

Stay well and take care.

Sekar
— Ndalem Maharani Guest House

likedText:
- super nicely furnished and decorated, really beautiful 
- good seating areas
- free drinking water to refill + tea/coffee
- large room
- Air conditioning top and not directly above the bed
- very nice caring staff (but unfortunately does not speak English very well)
- comfortable bed
- clean
- Wifi (basically good but a bit weak in a few places in my room or at a few times)
- Room service
- On my last evening I simply got a fruit plate in my room with 3 oranges and 4 salaks (snakefruits) - I've never had that before
- Top location, you can walk both to the south to Kraton and to the center to Malioboro Street (25 min walk)
dislikedText:
- unfortunately very permeable to noise, so you can hear the sounds of vehicles and the mosque in my room (number 1) relatively loudly
- Communication in English was a bit difficult, but the staff was still very, very caring 
- Wifi (basically good but a little weak in a few places in my room or at a few times - especially when you have a meeting, it is relatively difficult with a few interruptions)

likedText:
The people are so, so nice over here! We were sick the first couple of days and they brought us fruits and singkong and they really took care of us. 

We stayed here for 2 weeks and at the end of the 2 weeks these people felt like family.

Also the location is good, the place is clean and spacious, the airco is at the right place, you have hot showers and just everything you need. And if not, the people here wil take care of it for you! 

Our shower did not work properly after a couple of minutes and we immediately got an upgrade to an even bigger room for 1 week while they took care of preparing the shower.

It was such a good place to stay, I recommend it to everyone!! ❤️

likedText: The hotel is located in the heart of the city and has a very beautiful lobby and the staff were incredibly professional, helpful and nice at all times.
dislikedText:
My room was really unclean. It did not seem that they had cleaned it before I arrived. There were lots of spider webs all over the room and bathroom, under the bed it was dusty, there were ants, and even between the floor by the desk and the wall, there was an old and used mask, accumulating dust. It was unpleasant to sleep in a room like that. 
Also the curtains in the room, which was located right by the lobby, were quite transparent, which let a lot of light in from sunrise and did not allow for much privacy at night.

Lovely areas for sitting around the pool and in the courtyard.
Staff very polite and attentive. Helped us arrange transport to Borobudur at a very reasonable price.
dislikedText: On the first day we said that we didn’t need the room cleaning. We’d have liked it doing on the second day and did ask, however it wasn’t done until day 3.
reviewTitle: Lovely place to base yourself during a stay in Yogyakarta

likedText: We loved our stay at Omah Siliran Heritage. The staff were so friendly and the room very comfortable. It was lovely to chill around the pool.
dislikedText: It was difficult to get to the many restaurants south of the hotel via walking due to the roads. An additional blind or curtain in the room would be helpful to stop the light in the morning!

likedText: Super comfortable bed, really nice and helpful staff. Location was good, just sorry we could only stay for 2 nights.

The room and the traditional Javanese house pendapa and entrance is peaceful and soothing.  I got a room in an annex so it was so calm.   There was an abundant hot water to take shower.  The staff is so kind. Ms. Itta is very caring.   They let me use their fridge.   I like the swimming pool as well although it is small.
dislikedText:
TV is impossible to operate.   I finally had to give up, although three staff came to my room to figure out how to operate it.   The staff was cooking something in the kitchen of the dining space where guests hang out.  I thought it was for guests, too.   But it turned out it was only for the staff.  (A staff said to me, later, that I can try if it is just a try. It was nice soup.) 
Because it is inside the court property closed with fortress, you have to make such a detour to get to this hotel even when coming from very nearby.
reviewTitle: This is a gem in the kraton.

likedText: Stuff especially a lady who is charge in resepsiyon,friendly,helpful and always gives to positive energy
dislikedText: Breakfast

likedText:
The host made us feel so welcome and went to great lengths to ensure our stay was memorable.

The venue is beautifully appointed, very tastefully decorated, has outdoor lounge area and swimming pool. The bed is KIng size, is firm and very comfortable

The breakfast in the morning is absolutely stunning with local dishes and as much coffee/tea and toast to accompany this.

The host even accommodated our early trip to Burubudor with an early cooked breakfast.

By far the best venue we have stayed in so far on our 6 week tour of Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia and Vietnam.

I would certainly recommend staying here.
dislikedText: It would be very hard to find fault with the venue, my only comment would be that the motorbikes that pass on the street next to the outdoor lounge area can sometimes be very noisy.  City living, I guess

likedText: The staff were friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was tasty traditional style, ingredients bought from the local markets in the early hours and freshly cooked every morning.   The bed very comfortable and a great location.
reviewTitle: Very comfortable and would stay again.

likedText: Confortable bed and great shower, beautiful room by the swimming pool. Breakfast included.
dislikedText: It was a bit difficult to communicate with staff, as they didn't understand English very well, but they were nice qnd friendly:)

likedText: The room was clean, pool area quite nice, good vibe.
dislikedText: The common area is quite loud from the room and light left on overnight is annoying. Breakfast just so-so.
reviewTitle: Good value, wouldn’t be first choice next time, but would be happy to stay again.

likedText: Tger

Stay was just for one night. At first the room did not feel very private as the only thing covering the window was a see through white curtain. This was an issue for me as the common area was right in front of the rooms window. The staff quickly fixed this for me. Wifi didn't work in the room but this was also quickly fixed by the friendly staff. One of the reasons I booked this place was for the pool, and it is nice, but the water could have been cleaner. Overall the hotel delivered and the staff are friendly. As a bonus I really appreciated the breakfast that was of local cuisine. Can recommend to business or family travellers.
reviewTitle: A unique and authentic place. The minor issues were quickly fixed by friendly staff.

likedText: Good location, friendly staff, shared communal areas and hotel facilities such as pool were good.
dislikedText: No curtain in room to block out light, just thin white window covering. Looked over private parking which didn't feel very private when it was dark and you had the light on. Stain on bedding.
reviewTitle: Would recommend with minor improvements for the price

likedText: The hotel is quite nice; staff could maybe be a bit more talkative but overall it is ok. The style is nice and beds comfortable. One criticism is the way rooms are placed; our room was right in the kitchen area - as there are no shutters in the room, it may get uncomfortable to have light in the night, hear people talking while being in the kitchen, especially if no rules are specified.. We appreciated the flowers and preparations for our honeymoon. Privacy and tranquillity is also important - maybe more isolation measures or rules in the hotel could be an option to make guests stay more pleasant.
dislikedText: Size of room (very small compared with photos); food might take into consideration peoples tastes and allergies. Position of room and lack of privacy

likedText: Nice location and outdoor spaces. Local breakfast was decent and the staff were kind. The air con was excellent.
dislikedText: The curtains were extremely thin and did not fully cover the window so other guests could see into the room from certain angles, and since there was a porch light left on through the night outside the room it was extremely bright shining in. Other guests belongings were in the room still when we checked in (under the bed and cabinet)
reviewTitle: beautiful, but lacking in comfort and privacy. very bright at night

likedText: None.
dislikedText: The room was small, bathroom got moulds, room and bathroom doors were falling apart, towels were old, the floor towel was dirtier than mud! The bedside lights didn't even have bulbs in it. They featured breakfast in their hotel info, but apparently they have not provided breakfast for 4 years already! They provide free coffee/tea facilities but I don't think they ever washed the cups! The alun-alun was rather disappointing and the guest house is far from main road. You need to have Grab app. No taxis around at all. We only stayed 2 of 3 nights booked, we just had to get out of there. We stayed 2 nights only because on the 2nd day we had whole day tour booked starting at 4am, so had no time to move places. Definitely would not go back there! I am disappointed that booking.com is promoting this place at all!
reviewTitle: Not recommended, unless you just want a bed space to sleep on

The people you see on the street don't have much as in materialism but looking into there eyes you see much happiness and a big smile.You get to see a side of life that is still very traditional right outside the front door and still walking distance to Taman sari,  the palace and the moliaboro shops. Bella and the staff are very helpfull

likedText: lovely Facade￼ overall. Garden and pool are was nice and old style Javanese decore all around.
Lovely pool and garden area, and the included breakfast was delicious. Very secure entrance, wifi in the room worked well. Standard clean and comfy modest room.
dislikedText:
Just be mindful there are mini-bats swooping down to get a little drink from the pool in the evening. We thought it was fun but you might not! 

Like other hotels in Jogja city it is very close to many mosques, so the morning prayer is very loud. Bring earplugs if that will bother you :)

likedText: The location was convienient. The staff was polite.
dislikedText: There were not enough working sockets in the room. The room wasn't clean enough. Hot water was running out after a short while. The staff wasn't always responsive enough to the additional requests (queries sent via booking.com etc).
reviewTitle: Value for money was not satifactory.

likedText: Included breakfast is very good. Staff very nice and helpful. Bella introduced us to the important food delivery and taxi apps in Indonesia. Pool is nice, our son enjoyed it a lot. Would book again.
dislikedText: You always have to order a taxi to check out some of the sights (Malioboro, etc). Rather few restaurants in the immediate area. Our rooms only window was to the hallway. My father in laws room was a bit damp. But all in all no problem for us.

likedText:
Warm welcome on arrival from Bella. Very homely feel. Very spacious room , balcony and en-suite. Tea, Coffee and Water in the room. 

Breakfast was pre-ordered the night before, which meant an efficient service in the morning. - and the food was absolutely delicious. 

Beautiful pool area and pond with fish.

Nothing was too much trouble, Bella advised us on where to go for activities & food and assisted in ordering taxis.
dislikedText: N/A
reviewTitle: Highly recommend this place, a real home from home with warm, friendly and professional staff - we will definitely stay

likedText: We loved our stay here, the rooms are spacious, beds are comfy, the bathroom nice with facilities working well. The pool is a lovely area for relaxing. Breakfast has a few choices and cooked to order. The staff were fabulous, attentive and so helpful making our stay wonderful and the reason we extended our stay here.

Big room and confi bead. Perfect location to explore Jogjakarta, only 20 minutes walk to the center and the Kraton palace. The mosque is only to be heard once a day around 6 p.m. for one hour, so not disturbing very much. Bella from the service team was so helpful and supported us to order a Grab taxi for a good price. She also recommended a tour agency for Borobodur and a local restaurant that was sooo yummy and cheap. So don't hesitate to ask. 

Wi-Fi is working well, same in the room as in the restaurant, if you need to work.
Super nice breakfast with pancakes or Nasi Goreng, omelette and fresh fruits.
dislikedText: The kitchen which can also be used by guests might be cleaner. But it's also up to the guests to keep it clean themselves.
reviewTitle: Very quiet and peaceful central location

likedText:
Nous avons vraiment apprécié le séjour

Le personnel est très sympathique et accueillant ! Au petit soin

likedText: Un hôtel familial où règne l'hospitalité et la gentillesse des personnes. Le cadre est magnifique. Les petits déjeuners fait maison.
dislikedText: Rien.

likedText: Sehr nettes Personal dass uns sehr gute Tipps gab., Frühstück war sehr gut.
Le petit-déjeuner et l'accueil. Le balcon. Le mini frigo dans la chambre.
dislikedText: Cette guest house aurait besoin de rénovation. Il manque des prises.

likedText:
De mensen die er werken zijn super vriendelijk. Het bed is prima groote evenals de kamer. 
De badkamer is is netjes.
dislikedText: De kamer had wel een likje verf nodig, ziet de scheuren in de muur. Ook bij het zwembad had het allemaal iets schoner mogen zijn.

likedText:
La disponibilité et la gentillesse du personnel. Petit déjeuner copieux . Chambre spacieuse ainsi que la literie. Changement des serviettes tous les jours. Propreté de la chambre et de l'hôtel en général.
Lieu a la fois éloigné du tumulte de la ville et proche pour s'y promener. 
Commande d'un scooter sur place avec prix correct, service de nettoyage des vêtements en 24h et service de taxi pour le retour a l'aéroport commandé par le réceptionniste.
dislikedText: Wifi disponible mais non fonctionnel.

likedText: La piscine et les petits déjeuner
dislikedText: Odeur salle de bain

likedText: Das Frühstück war gut. Man wählt am Vortag, was man möchte. Sowohl Indonesisches Frühstück als auch der westlicher Toast waren verfügbar. Es gab auch immer frisches Obst. Für uns verwöhnte Westeuropäer und vor allem für meinem dauerhungrigen achtjährigen Sohn hätte es ein bisschen mehr sein können und ich hätte mich auch über einen zweiten Kaffee gefreut aber sonst war das Personal sehr nett und hat geholfen, wo es konnte.  Empfehlenswert sind die Zimmer im 1. Stock. Der Pool ist ganz zauberhaft.
dislikedText: Bei einigen Mitarbeitern war der englische Wortschatz sehr begrenzt. Die Zimmer im EG sind sehr dunkel und es waren ein paar Ameisen zu viel  für meinen Geschmack. Wir haben deshalb auch im 1. OG gewohnt. Ich hätte mir eine bessere Verfügbarkeit von Pool-Handtüchern gewünscht. Restaurant raussuchen und hinlaufen - wie wir Deutschen das gerne machen - war nicht möglich. Macht da aber auch keiner und Grab hat uns gut gefahren. Alles in Allem Jammern auf hohem Niveau. Griya Yunika ist absolut empfehlenswert - auch für Europäer.

likedText: The property was in the perfect location for 3 days exploring Yogyakarta! The family are super warm and welcoming and made us feel extremely welcome and comfortable in their lovely home. Amazing value for money - couldn’t fault our stay🫶🏼
Very good place to say in Yogyakarta! The host was very nice as well!

It's all in the name, "Rumah kita" definitely felt like my house/home. Michael and Micah were extremely helpful with suggestions on how to best spend my time on Yogyakarta, they even took me out to dinner to experience a wonderful local restaurant and made me feel very welcome! I loved spending evenings outside in the common area just chatting with them. The whole vibe of the house is very homely and the collected vintage furniture adds a warm touch. I was very sad to leave and will 100% only be staying here next time I visit Yogyakarta!
dislikedText: That I had to leave! :(
reviewTitle: Truly felt like home! Amazing BnB!

likedText: I loved the place the staf was very friendly and micah is so sweet and funny. The place also is so clean .highly recommended
dislikedText: Nothing

likedText: Great location, the hosts are really welcoming and helpful!! Overall, it was clean and the accommodations are pretty cute (especially the bathroom).
dislikedText: There’s two owl attached to a tree in the garden. As animal lovers, we were absolutely shocked!! Also, it was very dirty under our bed. But for the rest, great stay if you plan to move a lot during the day.

likedText:
The host was very kings, friendly and funny. 
The animals and specially the baby owl.

Great for a short stay, perfect base for exploring yogyakarta

likedText: The atmosphere

Good location. I'd suggest this homestay to those who put location as a priority

As someone that really love to do self-service, i really love the idea of self checkin! very flexible and you can whatsapp them directly after book for the confirmation. Do not expect it like a hotel okay! but this homestay is total comfort and clean (i booked the superior AC, the bedsheet is smells good) with a nice backyard to chill. The best part is kid not allowed in this homestay, very nice for those travelling solo that dont like kids screaming or crying while resting :)
dislikedText: hard to find parking if you drive a car or motorcycle

likedText: room, toilet and bathroom are good ;)

likedText:
The house is very homey and cozy with its unique vintage furniture, the room comfortable and clean, as well as the bathroom and kitchen facilities.
The position is also really strategic, near the main tourist attractions and within walking distance to many eats and shops.
But the highlight are definitely Michael, Tya & family (Bonzo included OFC), their hospitality and warmth is what makes Rumah Kita! 
I'd definitely book here again if I'm in the area.

Thank you so much for everything 😊

· I had a great stay at Rumah Kita BnB. The house has the grandma home vibe and it's very Homey. Listya's family was very friendly and helpful. They helped me book shuttle to Borobudur and Prambanan. Baby K and Bonzo was def the highlight <3. Def recommend it if you want to experience living with locals. They also rent out motorcycle and bicycle so very convenience :D
propertyResponse:
Thank you for your nice, encouraging words :)
It was our pleasure to have you as our guest. We do our best effort to make our guests feel comfortable with their stay at our home. Glad you liked it!

likedText: location is quite nice. it’s an old house decorated with nice pieces of vintage finds. the rooms are decently sized. there is filtered water on premises.

dislikedText: The shower water pressure is not great, as the water falls onto the wall, but other than that everything was great
reviewTitle: We had a very nice time in Rumah Kita. The house is a cute little homestay with very nice staff

likedText:
- Great location close to Kraton and some nice restaurants
- Easy self check-in
- the family owns a cute dog
dislikedText: Unfortunately, we didn't really feel welcome from the start. The owner only introduced himself when asked and ignored us the rest of the time. This surprised us because we expected a warm and open atmosphere based on the good reviews. The other (few) guests seemed to be local long-term guests who were not really interested in interacting with us backpackers. Rather, we had the impression that we were only being tolerated, which is why we stayed in our room most of the time. The outdoor area was neglected which was also disappointing.

likedText: Clean bed room, friendly staff ^_^, I could easily access the Indonesian food nearby : Mie Jowo and Sate
dislikedText: Another room full with bikes and stuff, better to cover them :D also the shower, it would be better to install the longer one.

likedText: Our stay with Michael and Tya was amazing. They are such friendly people and their home is so unique. They made our stay in Yogya incredibly memorable. When we come back to Yogya, we will definitely stay with them again. Thank you so much Michael and Tya for showing us around and for taking us to your favorite restaurants.
dislikedText: Nothing, everything was great.

likedText:
Lovely place, I had a wonderful stay at Rumah Kita BnB - it truly was a home to me. Everyone is really friendly, the place had all I could ask for, it was very homey & cosy.
Area was local, everything one need in proximity and walking distance to the center and major sights, as well as bus stations nearby.

This is my second time staying here, and I always feel comfortable with the host and his staff, especially Bonzo, the place is clean, comfortable, the environment is not noisy, always feels like home.  I hope to be able to return to vacation there soon.
propertyResponse: Thank you for the sweet review! Let us know when you are planning to stay at our home again to get better rates than if you book elsewhere :)

likedText: Hotel met een eigen karakter, heel leuk. Eigenaar altijd in voor een praatje en is echt geïnteresseerd in zijn gasten. Ik raad je wel aan een kamer met AC te boeken als je niet goed tegen de warmte kan :) Vlakbij de superleukestraat Tirtodipuran / Jl. Prawitotaman.
Honestly, if I could give 0 stars or negative, I would. DO NOT BOOK HERE.
dislikedText: First of all, the photos you see when booking are severely outdated, or Photoshop has been used extensively to alter the reality of the facilities and aesthetics. From the moment I arrived, I was greeted by a very low-light space, a receptionist who barely spoke 2 words of English, and was given a room that had a musty smell, mold, and humidity spots all over the walls. The paint was chipping from the walls, ants were crawling everywhere, the bedding was in several off-white colors that smelled, and of course, the bathroom had a moldy floor, no soap, no paper, and a broken flush that kept me awake the nights I stayed. Now I immediately contacted booking.com with evidence to claim that there were concerns in this property and the accommodation itself, to maybe work things out; however, after the property asked me what they could do, and I responded, they ghosted me. For 25 days straight, after I messaged the property almost every day, they never got back to me even once. Booking.com wasn't even helpful in mediating, as they kept pushing me to get a written confirmation from the property for a refund of my money, when the property just ignored all forms of communication. I am very disappointed at this for obvious reasons, especially as someone who thought the platform would protect me in case anything happened, now, I'm at a financial loss as I had to book elsewhere for my long trip in Indonesia, and there are no indications of a possible refund for now.
reviewTitle: Absolutely horrible property and no efforts to resolve issues
propertyResponse:
Dear Androniki,
We deeply regret that your experience at Super OYO 90778 River Inn Malioboro was so disappointing. Please accept our sincerest apologies for the issues you encountered with the condition of the room, the lack of cleanliness, and the lack of communication. This is certainly not the standard of service we aim to provide.

We take your feedback seriously and will immediately escalate the concerns you’ve raised to the relevant teams for further investigation and resolution. We understand how frustrating this situation must have been, and we are committed to addressing it.

In the meantime, we encourage you to reach out to our customer support team directly, and we will do our best to assist you in resolving this matter promptly.

Thank you for sharing your feedback, and we hope to improve your experience with us in the future.
Sincerely,
Team OYO River Inn Malioboro

dislikedText: Rooms were not clean, staff was not well-trained and hard to talk to (A/C was broken and had to talk hard to give us another room), no common area even to wait around, and a bit of a walk from Malioboro. I have had much better stay at other OYO hotels.
propertyResponse: Dear, Myat! Sorry for the unpleasant experience you had with us. Thank you for sharing the feedback, we are using this as an opportunity to escalate the matter with the relevant team. Regards, Kiman!

likedText: The only redeeming factor of this dump was the fact that there was a door via which you could leave, which we did as soon as we found an alternative place to stay.
dislikedText:
This place was appalling. We arrived to a room that was filthy, including bedsheeds that had beed used. We demanded they change the sheets, to whixh at first, they simply insiated that the sheets we clean. When they finally agreed to replaced the sheets, we found the duvet to be bloodstained and the pillows were mouldy. The staff insisted they couldn't be switched because all were like this. They said it waa thereason they used pillowcases.

The new sheets we were given had fresh blood on them - obviously no concern about safety.

The staff was appalling. The only way to communicate was via translate, and they simply did not care that the hotel waa unfit for habitation. They also smoked in the hallways, despite the "no smoking" sign next to their heads.

DO NOT be fooled by the pictures on this site. They bear no resemblance to reality. This website embarrasses itself by even listing this pathetic excuse for a hotel.

dislikedText: Номер грязный, с плесенью и пятнами от убитый Комаров на стенах. Окно закрыто занавеской, так как оно супер грязное и ее не мыли может целый год. Постельное белье старой в грязных пятнах. Были волосы на кровати. Я попросила поменять белье и мне сказали, что номер убирали недавно и не стали ничего делать. В номере нет раковины, только душ и унитаз. Ни места чтобы положить чемодан, только на пол грязный. Вместо 3 ночей я осталась только на 1 ночь и на следующий день поменяла отель. На ресепшене даже не извинились
propertyResponse: Здравствуйте, Олеся! Нам очень жаль, что Вы остались не совсем довольны нашими услугами. Уверяем Вас, мы будем стараться день и ночь, чтобы Ваши будущие визиты были более комфортными и спокойными. С уважением, Ной.

likedText: Very responsive staff when handing over the keys. We had exchanged messages through whatsapp days prior to organise the meeting. Good location being in the centre of Jogja.  I like the overall house setting, the outdoor area is super cute and it feels homey. The host handled our complaint very well. The AC in the second bedroom was not working and the host was very helpful. They sent an AC technician to fix the problem. Then, we found out it could not be fixed straight away so the host helped us to get an alternative hotel for the second bedroom's guests.
dislikedText: No parking, it was inconvenient having to pay extra to leave the car. If I may suggest it could be better to include the parking in the price of the stay. Secondly, the bathroom. You have to walk through the main bedroom if you need to go to the bathroom. Even though there was a toilet downstairs, it hardly got used as it was all the way downstairs and the squatting toilet was not suitable for my elderly parents who stayed in the second bedroom.
reviewTitle: It was a lovely home in the heart of Jogja. Reasonably priced and great customer service.

Our first room had a lot of broken things, we could not take a shower....it was broken. First, they did not want give us another room because we were women!! When my husband came to the reception desk, the employee immediately changed our room. We really didn't appreciate this, women have rights like men!

likedText: Close to malioboro street, right in front of the tugu station.
dislikedText: They’re asked me to pay for the dirty duvet my kid made by her nail color and eating some chocolate. They said it was 2 duvets which is actually only one who is dirty. For one duvet should be 425.000 rupiah. They said can’t remove the dirty one, I was just like wtf it’s can remove. Without checking properly they easily say I need pay for that. Of course I’m not just saying ok. I told them the dirty duvet is only one and can washed. So in the end I only pay 250.000 rupiah after the other stuff check again the room. I understood for the trouble my kid made, but to be honest this is the first time I had this experience. I been in so many hotel for my family holiday, but this hotel is really annoyed me because it’s ridiculous when one stuff came to the room and asked me about the dirty duvet he said 2 duvets dirty and I said come in check again it’s only one and can remove, then he said oh ok only one but without looking 🤣 and I said if it’s really can’t washed it I can pay full 425.000 rupiah but give me the duvet and he said ok. When I checked out, they check again they said only one dirty and can wash it but I should pay 250.000 rupiah for the treatment 🤣

likedText:
The room was comfortable enough for me and family, but room size is not too big especially when extra bed inside. The hotel provide mini bar for free. I got 6 bottle of meniral water but on the second day, they forgot to refill. The bathroom is not too big, but its okay. Breakfast not so vary but enough.
Location is very strategic, very near to the train station and malioboro street. Easy to find something to eat near the hotel, private laundry services also nearby.
dislikedText:
The soap provided in the bathroom was few and difficult to pump. Narrow parking lot. When closing the door you must push it very hard otherwise its still unlocked and others can easily enter you room, eventhough the door make sounds when you did not close it properly, most of the guests did not realize it .I keep hearing those noises in the middle of the night. Suggest to the hotel staff to remind the guests if the door make some noise which mean they did not close the door properly.
You can easily go to the each room floor, and the lift can take us to the floor we want to go without scanning our room key which I think the hotel management should think the safety of the guests with this condition.

Location is so convenient as is just Infront of the train station, so perfect if you arriving late at night. Is so many places around to rent a motorbike. The room was lovely and clean. The staff very helpful and nice.

reviewTitle: I stayed because I already booked a few months before I stay but they still put me in bad room. very disappointed

likedText: I couldn’t enjoy anything at this hotel as I spent my whole stay there searching for my luggage that the hotel staff gave (intentionally or unintentionally is still unclear) to another person. I only had 2 hours to sleep and still paid full price for my stay, with zero compensation for a nightmare they made me go through.
dislikedText:
I left my luggage with a hotel luggage tag in the security room before check in. When I was back, the hotel kept saying me that they will bring the luggage to my room, but after several questions when it will be, they never brought it. This is how I found out that they didn’t have one of my bags anymore, it was my backpack that had my work laptop and and my documents that was missing. I had to stay hours looking at security cameras to see what happened. In the end I saw  that they gave my backpack to another person, I don’t know if it was intentionally or unintentionally. It took many hours to find out everything and get my stuff back (the driver that supposedly had my backpack all day, returned it only after we called him). The hotel stuff was rude and unwilling to say what was going on most of the time, they were refusing to call the police for a long time. There was only  one person who seemed to try to help more genuinely. I couldn’t work (I planned to work all day  from this hotel) and got in trouble at work because of this. I still had to pay the full price of the hotel room, although I couldn’t use any of its services between looking at my stuff and going to the police station. 
At the police station the personal of the hotel were with me, and after I filed the report I saw how they were giving money to the policeman. When I asked why they did it, they said it was for coffee.
Terrible experience, never went through something like this before.
reviewTitle: Nightmare. I spent my whole stay looking for my luggage that the hotel stole/gave to another person

likedText: Great location, nice staff.

likedText: Location was excellent, close to train station, shops etc. Very easy check in/out. Comfortable bed.

dislikedText: none
reviewTitle: Location just in front of  the train station and local culinary center, and just walking distance to Malioboro

likedText:
Rooms are good and clean, though there's no safe or fridge to keep anything cool.
The bathroom functions fine, though it's a little cramped.

Staff themselves are very friendly though and it's good value for money if you're travelling on a budget.
dislikedText:
There's a light that runs along the top of the curtain rail that turns on in the evening and turns off at around midnight or 1am. You can't control that light yourself which is quite annoying so bring a sleeping mask.
Also, the AC seems to turn off at some point in the night which meant my partner and I ended up waking up at odd hours in the morning too warm and had to turn the AC on again. Not sure if it was because of a preset sleep mode that I just wasn't able to figure out on the remote.
It's right next to the main train station so it's still quite noisy at night but honestly not that bad.

likedText: Close to the palace. Friendly staff. Good value for money.
dislikedText: Bit hard for Grab taxi to find the property. Only close to the palace and not other tourist areas

likedText: Very clean, quite, and good location
dislikedText: The towel could be more soft

likedText:
Great location, everybody was nice, there's hot water and cold water from a shared pantry area. The place is super cute. The rooms are arranged like little houses around the shared pantry area, so there's an outdoor feel.

It's walkable to the Kraton, Malioboro, lots of cafes and food places around. As a solo female traveller it feels safe. It's in like a kampong vibe neighbourhood and I felt safe walking around the area on my own at night looking for food etc.

Bed is comfortable and air-conditioning is good. TV has Netflix. You get breakfast which is good, it's like the kind of meal you get from a school event: rice, protein, vegetables and a snack.
dislikedText: There was no hot water in the shower, but it's hot outside so it's okay.

likedText: Lovely staff, rooms and air con were great. Good location.
dislikedText: A pool would have been nice but we didn't have time to use it anyway as there were so many things to see and do nearby.

likedText: Fantastic
dislikedText: None

reviewTitle: Great location - you can walk to the palace.

likedText: Simple accomodation. Relatively comfortable but the aircon struggled. The guesthouse is incredibly close to the Kraton (Sultan’s Palace) and the Sonobudoyo Museum as well as other historic sites.
dislikedText: There is a common area for people to eat and drink and it’s very popular with people staying up to all hours talking. The sounds echoes around the guesthouse and unfortunately, we were close by. I did ask the desk to speak to the guest and ask them to quieten down but they seemed hesitant to do so (this was at 11pm).

dislikedText: I found a cockroach in my room.

likedText: The vibes is good, homey and clean.

The breakfast was terrible 1 banana 1 mandarin 1 fried egg which could bounce and 4 1/2 pieces of very very thin bread. No even a plate to eat off. And not even a fresh cup of coffee. You could go to the small open air dining room and make coffee - the coffee was in a jar and terrible and the enamel mugs provided were markedly stainef
reviewTitle: Room very comfortable. Breakfast more than terrible.  Management did not care - their attitude if th

likedText: love the AC. works well. the tv is equipped with smart tv so we can watch netflix. the guest house is cozy, comfortable and homey. tourist attractions are walking distance and since it is near lots of famous restaurants or stall, food delivery fee is cheaper.

likedText: Excellent location, walking distance to Kraton Palace, Ramayana Ballet, Museum and the Wayang at Museum, Malioboro street. The staff was very kind. We could have left our luggages at the office as we arrived earlier than check-in time. The room is comfortable with AC. We stayed in a family room with no window but it was not disturbing at all. The kitchen in the atrium with coffee and tea was great place to sit. We had to leave earlier and the lunch box was very good, egg, frites, fresh fruits. We enjoyed the nice atmosphere of the building.
reviewTitle: Great location, friendly and clean guesthouse

likedText:
Young and very helpful staff. The breakfasts were good and it was nice to be able to sit at a table in the communal area to enjoy the breakfast. The bedroom was not very spacious but adequate for a short stay in the city.
Facilities very clean and modern.
The location is excellent. Once I found my way around, it was lovely to walk between the guesthouse and Malioboro street. Since the guesthouse is in a primarily pedestrian suburb, it was very quiet.
dislikedText: It would have been nice if my room had an outside window. I had to keep my curtains closed all the time, which made the room very dark. A small bar fridge in the room would have enhanced my stay.
reviewTitle: Avery nice stay in a busy city. Excellent location, very clean. Helpful staff.

The guest house is within walking distance to Kraton Palace (very near around 5 mins), and even Malioboro. We would stay here again on our next time. Recommended.

likedText: Saya cek in jam 24.00 krna memang naik kereta jam segitu..begitu sampai,kamar sudah disiapkan dg bersih,rapi,harum dan juga dingin.kamar mandi bersih dan harum,air hangat berfungsi dg baik.di dalam kamar disediakan prlengakapan mandi dan air mineral yg tiap hari akan di refill..ada teko listrik untuk merebus air..sarapannya enaakk..mas yg jaga dan owner nya baik sekali..ramah..masyaa allah sungguh memuaskan

likedText: A lovely and cozy place with a thoughtfully designed room that makes great use of the small space. The pool area looked inviting, even though we didn’t get the chance to use it during our stay. The staff were exceptionally kind and accommodating. As we had to leave early before breakfast, they went the extra mile to prepare a takeaway meal for us. A great touch of hospitality!
dislikedText:
We encountered some ants on our blankets, so we decided to remove them from the room for the night. The air conditioning worked fine, but due to the small size of the room, it cooled down very quickly. However, once the AC was turned off, the room became hot and humid. Perhaps with the blankets, it would have been more comfortable.

The biggest challenge we faced was the early morning prayer at 4 a.m., which was extremely loud and lasted quite a while (the last one we heard ended about 40 minutes later). While this is likely the case for most city center locations, it can be difficult to sleep through if you’re not accustomed to it. Even earplugs might not block out the sound entirely. It’s something to consider if you’re sensitive to noise or value uninterrupted sleep.
reviewTitle: Cozy Stay with Great Hospitality but Some Room for Improvement
propertyResponse:
Hello Ariane 

Thank you for your review, we appreciate it.

Our apology for the ants, since we didn’t heard anything about this from your side when it was happened, so we couldn’t change the blanket for you immediately.

About the air conditioning you can always change the temperature to any degree you desire by using the remote control, which is located inside the room.

Overall we are sorry we couldn’t improve our service for you the next day, since you stayed only one night and checked out the next day already. 

Regarding the morning prayer we are sorry for this, since it’s out of our control. 
As you said, this happens everywhere in Java unfortunately.

Have a good day.

Kind regards, 
Sastro place team

Im not sure how it gets such high ratings
