propertyResponse: Yang terhormat Ibu Lulu, - Serve with care and love from Cordela Hotel Kartika Dewi Malioboro Yogyakarta - Terima kasih atas waktu yang telah diluangkan untuk menuliskan rating dan review Cordela Hotel Kartika Dewi Malioboro Yogyakarta. Bu Lulu, mohon maaf apabila selama Ibu menginap di Hotel Cordela ada beberapa fasilitas yang kurang berkenan terutama dalam menu makanan yang kami hidangkan, semoga kami tetap bisa memberikan pelayanan yang baik pada kunjungan berikutnya. Kami tunggu kedatangan Ibu dan keluarga selanjutnya. Cordially, Jameswatt Daeli Hotel Manager

likedText: Nice English-speaking staff. Clean room. Very cozy common area. Sweet architecture. And we could leave our luggage here prior our check in and post our check out.
dislikedText:
Unfortunately no breakfast offered. 

Common area is cozy, but it would be nice if you offered some drinks and snacks for buying (free water, coffee, tea available though)

When taking a shower, the toilet is set under water.

The room nearest to the street is really really really loud. We are used to noisy rooms, but the window is so thin that you got the feeling, that you are sitting on the sidewalk of a busy street. Also the mosque nearby sounds like the megaphone is located your room and they start off very early in the morning. Also the inner door points into the main lobby and you will hear any coming and leaving guest plus checkout procedure.

This room should be seriously discounted, you won't be able to get normal sleep here.
reviewTitle: Clean rooms, nice staff but extremely noicy

likedText: Everything. The staff, above all, but also the comfy and cozy vibe of the property, the location, the patio…
reviewTitle: The Bloomy House is one of my favorite places I booked in this website. And the friendliness of Jack and Julia make the

likedText: Family room, dining area..
dislikedText: Nope

likedText:
Julia is very friendly and quite knowledgeable. She arranged a private driver for us, who is highly recommended. English was not a problem.

Our family room was in the middle section, and it was quiet there. The front rooms are near the street and the entrance. The back rooms are by the courtyard, which is accessible to all guests. There, you can prepare drinks. There is also a communal kitchen that looked well-maintained.

The room amenities were clean but very basic and could therefore be a bit cheaper. However, the price is probably based on the local rent.
propertyResponse: Hello , thank you for your nice review 🙏😊

likedText: Clean, best location and economical.
dislikedText: My room had fan. Those who are heat sensitive choose the room with AC.
propertyResponse: Hello, thank you for your nice review, we really appreciate it 🙏

likedText:
The hosts are very helpful and always there for their guests. 
The room and bathroom were very, very clean. 
The nearby street could only be heard a little in the room, later in the evening it was quiet. 
It was really nice to sit in the courtyard.
The homestay is well located for sightseeing in Yogyakarta; shops, restaurants and a great ice cream parlor can also be reached after a short walk.
dislikedText:
Unfortunately, the guest kitchen was not very clean and we were not invited to use it.
For example, the dishwashing sponge would need to be replaced urgently.
reviewTitle: A pleasant homestay, we would stay here again

likedText:
It was a clean, the bed was comfortable, air conditioning worked well. Location was convenient, easy to walk to nearby coffee shops and restaurants. Loved the little garden area with coffee and tea to chill with friends. There is a small kitchen and also a fridge and water dispenser. 
Julia was super helpful with planning our day, suggesting places to visit, nearby restaurants, good place for a massage, arranging a private car for a tour. Thank you Julia for making our stay so memorable.
dislikedText: Water pressure in the shower was slow, washing hair took a while. Bathroom is small so everything is wet after a shower. But not a deal breaker. The room facing the road lets the traffic sounds in but late in the night it’s not bad.
propertyResponse: thank you for your nice review, we really appreciate it 🙏🙏🙏

likedText: All very good
propertyResponse: Thank you for staying here  :)

likedText: very warm welcome, comfortable, like arriving at home. Thanks guys!
propertyResponse: thanks for your nice review Alex

likedText: Its an exceptional Hostel. One of the best ones I have been so far. Its small but you will feel like home. There is a beautiful garden inside where you can chill out  during your stay and in the afternoon. Room is very comfy with two beds and some basic furniture. There is hanger outside for your wet towels. Bathroom is clean and quite big. There was just one thing which was annoying and this the bathroom light switch, which will also automatically switch-on the noisy fan (it can wake up rest of the family members). Breakfast is tasty, I am sure you will enjoy it. The host and his wife are super friendly. They will help you with getting around and arranging driver for whole day, which can take you to Prambanan, Borobudur, Merapi mountain, Watterfalls, Mariboro street, Luwang Coffee etc. It was also our pleasure to talk with them about daily life in Yogya. Hostel is ver close to the Sultan Palace and Mariboro, so you can make it by walk. Would happily return again, because we felt like at home all the time.
dislikedText: Noisy fan in the bathroom, but its only trifle in this beautiful oase.
propertyResponse: thank you for your nice review, we really appreciate it 🙏☺️

likedText:
Had a great stay at the bloomy house. Well situated and the gazebo inside is very nice to chill in. 

Thank you again Jack for picking me up when I got lost & Julia for your kindness, lovely chats and help with the tour of the temples.

likedText: The Bloomy House is a place where you can feel at home. There is everything you need to visit Yogyakarta: a very comfortable and tidy room and a curated common space. It's near to the city center and restaurants. You can also book a tour or a driver to visit the surroundings.

- smelly bathroom. Something not right with the drainage

likedText: The house, service

likedText: Location is great as it is within walking distance to Malioboro Street where there will always big crowds.
dislikedText: My wife can't sleep on the first night and we decided to move to a hotel.

likedText: Ibnu was a very accommodating host who helped us with a late check-in and check-out. The villa was very,  very clean and had everything we needed.  It was a nice refuge from the busy streets of Jogja and the pool was fabulous at the end of each day.
dislikedText: We liked it all.  As other people have said,  it can be a bit noisy but we realised that would be everywhere.  It didn't stop us having a good night's sleep.

likedText: Please read both the positive and negative parts of this review. The villa is very interesting: the swimming pool is the first thing you see, and the living and dining areas are next to this (these areas are covered, but open air). This makes it a nice place to hang out- the pool is quite cool. The rooms are comfortable, with very comfortable beds, and the furniture and decorations of a good standard. The roof terrace is a bit open, but does give decent views over the city. The location is great, a few minutes from Malioboro.
dislikedText:
The lack of walls is problematic, as the villa is right next to a busy road and a junction, with all of the traffic noise this means. And the traffic noise goes on all day, and all night. Sleeping is a real issue, as the windows are big and off practically no insulation from all the noise. Additionally, the curtains are light-coloured and let in a lot of light early in the morning. Add to this the call to prayer, and you understand that you won't sleep well.

The lack of walls can also mean that things get in: food left out may be eaten, and a bat came in and made a mess of some chairs and the floor.
reviewTitle: Too noisy and open to the elements
propertyResponse: We apologize for the inconvenience of the simple villa and the building's insulation technology which is still inadequate. We truly regret the inconvenience. We hope that your review will be read by other prospective guests so that they do not make a reservation for our villa if they need peace which is indeed impossible to obtain in a city center like Yogyakarta which does not yet have noise regulations. We appreciate your input and we can only hope that the local government will pay attention to the aspirations of foreign guests from developed countries like you. Have a great day

likedText: The location of this spacious villa is great, the private pool is an enormous bonus when you're travelling with your family. I would highly recommend it!
dislikedText: It's a bit noisy at night, keep that in mind.
propertyResponse: Thanks a lot for your review. We realized there are many deficiencies in our property. We will take your valuable review seriously for improving our villa. The improvements is needed for all of our guests who look for the suitable accommodation in Indonesia. Have a great day

likedText: Nice large separate villa near the station. Own little swimming pool. Kitchen and washing machine came in handy. Two AC cooled sleeping rooms with each a queen bed and its own bathroom.
dislikedText: The ground floor is open so you can expect visitors (mice and cockroaches). Quite a lot of street noise all day, but that won't be much different elsewhere in Yogya. We didn't see the sofa bed anywhere so the villa is for a max of 4 people.
propertyResponse: Thanks a lot for your review. We really realize there are many weaknesses in our property. We will take care your valuable information very seriously. The improvements is very needed for all of our guests who like to have suitable accommodation in Indonesia. Have a great day

likedText: Very kind host who facilitated an early check-in for us. The property is really well located and well cleaned. We particularly enjoyed the rooftop terrace!
dislikedText: The street-facing room does let a bit of the traffic in, but it didn't deter us from getting great sleep throughout our time there!
propertyResponse: We humbly thank you for your very positive review. This review really helps us to continue to improve our services for guests who are enjoying the atmosphere of Yogyakarta. Have a nice day

Both the bedrooms had their own ensuites with plenty of light and the rooftop terrace was great for evening relaxation. Also the kitchen and laundry facilities was all that we wanted.

likedText:

Kalau ke Jogja pasti akan nginep di sini lagi.

dislikedText: Die Ausstattung ist nicht wie beschrieben. Es wird mit fleckenloser Bettwäsche und Waschmaschine geworben, dies ist aber nicht der Fall. Das Zimmer hatte an mehreren Ecken Spinnenweben und Staub. Auf dem Bett waren viele Haare und Flecken zu finden, so auch auf den Handtüchern. Kein Waschbecken vorhanden. Dusche und Klo sind nicht getrennt, weswegen alles Nass wird, da auch keine Ablage für Handtücher vorhanden ist. Das Frühstück welches wir Gebucht haben, wurde nicht Frisch vor Ort zubereitet sondern in einer Plastikschale mit Plastikbesteck gekauft und für uns an der Rezeption aufbewahrt. Das Zimmer entspricht auf keinem Fall den Bildern, welche auf Booking.com eingestellt sind.

likedText: The room was nice, clean and perfect for three people!
dislikedText:
The toilets were located in the hot showers only (so hard to use them in the morning)
The bathroom wasn’t really clean but still ok.
The staff, although nice, wasn’t really helpful and almost caused us to miss our train. We left our bags for the day and wanted to pick them back on the night. When we arrived, no one was here and no one actually rushed to help us so we were literally stuck without our stuff for more than 25 minutes (which sounds like nothing, but still a problem when you’re expecting a train and no one warned you about the fact that no one could be here). Anyway, rest assured that your stuff are safe if you leave them for the day. Additionally, they did not provide any info on how to visit the temples around yogya.
reviewTitle: Facilities ok but staff could be more helpful
propertyResponse:
We have provided a WhatsApp group for each guest. The use of this grup is to assist you regarding temples, and other travel tips any time of the day. Make sure to contact us via WA in advanced to avoid last minute situation last yours last night especially during the late hours. 

Best of luck for the rest of your travels, please check and follow each hostel rules when you stay. Thank you my friends.

likedText: In hotel industry hospitality distinguishes the good from the great, the inexpert from the professional. Checked in to 101 Style Malioboro and immediately impressed with the warm welcome, speed of checking in, modern design, nice room, comfy bed, fluffy pillows, and good bfast spread. Had a bit of technical glitches in the day that follows. The technician tried their best to rectify, profusely apologized for the minor problem. The receptions too tried their best to find me another available room. With the help of Bu Titta, the Manager on Duty, they (Bu Titta and her team) came up with workable alternative solutions. Bu Titta waited beyond her working shift hours to ensure everything settled well. Our gratitude to the team. Please pass along my appreciation to Bu Titta, the technician, and receptionist teams as they have demonstrated sincere hospitality. They showed resilient at times of diversity. The hospitality makes us feel we were well taken care of. I would look for 101 Style accommodations the next time I am in Indonesia.

propertyResponse:
Hi Tina,

Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We’re delighted to hear that you enjoyed our friendly staff, the breakfast selection, and our convenient location near Malioboro.

I’m sorry to hear that the check-in process was slow, the pool was crowded, and one of the rooms didn’t have the best view. I also want to mention that the gym’s air conditioning can be adjusted by guests—it's located near the entrance, so feel free to turn it on whenever you need.

Your comments are very valuable to us, and we will work on these issues to enhance our guest experience. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for an even better stay in the future!

Best regards,
Fitria A.
Front Office Manager

likedText: I must say, the location of the place is absolutely fantastic. What's more, the staff there is truly exceptional. During our stay, Francisco went above and beyond to help us by organizing tips around Yogyakarta. This was an additional benefit as it saved us the trouble of having to organize and search for a driver ourselves.
propertyResponse:
Dear Ms. Miha,
Warmest greeting from Novotel Suites Yogyakarta Malioboro. 

Thank you for staying with us and share your stay experience with positive feedback. We very much appreciate your warm words and kind rating. Knowing that you had great time during three nights stay with us make us confident to welcome you and your family for your upcoming stay. 

It is always pleasure received positive feedback, I will share it to Fransisco that you mentioned him on this review. Once again thank you for leaving this lovely feedback, hope to meet you again in the future.

Sincerely,
Windhu Kurnia (Duty Manager)

likedText: Good
dislikedText: None

likedText:
- Welcoming service culture - staff members always smiling and willing to help. 
- The hotel is well situated just off Malioboro St. Local attractions such as the Palace and Sonobudoyo Museum were within walking distance. It's also only about a 10 minute walk from the train station to the hotel. 
- The breakfast buffet had a good selection of local and western food.
dislikedText: There could have been a bit more attention to detail in terms of room cleaning. For example, a couple of the light switches felt a bit sticky upon check-in. I just cleaned them myself with an alcoholic wipe and they were fine. It was a minor issue that didn't detract from an enjoyable stay.
reviewTitle: Welcoming environment provided a great introduction to a first-time traveller to Indonesia.
